Tommy John is a comfort-focused lifestyle brand committed to solving the problem people have with their clothing. Most well-known for reimagining the fabric, fit, and function of underwear and undershirts, Tommy John has spent the past decade making the online and in-store shopping experience more comfortable. We are constantly on a mission to add smart, innovative and fun-loving team members, and are looking for a  Data Analyst, Product  to come join our New York based headquarters. Our HQ Office is located in Lower Manhattan and our teams are on-site 3 days per week. Reporting to the VP of Analytics, the Data Analyst, Product will work collaboratively with various teams across the organization to drive critical business decisions, extend our analytical capabilities, and work on incredibly interesting data problems. This person should be “full-stack”; equally capable of structuring and modeling data, uncovering novel insights, and convincing others by presenting those insights in a clear and concise way. This person will be a critical thought partner and an integral part of the way we work at Tommy John. Do you enjoy solving data problems with solutions that scale? Does a good README.md make you feel warm and fuzzy inside? Does “dry” describe your work better than your favorite pair of Tommy John Air underwear? Do you enjoy working closely with a fun team of data enthusiasts? If you answered yes to all these questions then we’d love to hear from you! Responsibilities: Partner with our Merchandising, Site, Marketing and Business leaders to empower better decisions through data-driven research and insights Design and analyze experiments to support product development Define and evaluate key metrics and understand what moves them and why Enhance product analytics capabilities to help us understand how our customers are using our products  Experience, Skills, & Attributes: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field 4+ years in a data role 2+ years of experience with behavioral analysis and feature optimization Demonstrates alignment with TJ core values:  Humble, Adaptable, Mindful, GSD, & Curious Familiarity with experimentation and product analytics tools 2+ years of experience with dbt  2+ years of experience with self-service BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Metabase) 2+ years working with a data warehouse (e.g. Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery) SQL wizard experienced in data modeling, query performance and optimization Proficient with Git A solid math and statistics background Strong analytical intuition and business acumen Ability   to be on-site in our HQ Office in Lower Manhattan 3 days per week Demonstrated experience in a similar role, within a fast-paced, high growth technology company and Experience in an Analytical Programming Language (Python or R) are preferred but not required Some awesome reasons to join us at Tommy John: Our Team Culture of Collaboration and Community; Happy Office, Culture and DEI Events, Fun Snacks and Happy Hours Comprehensive Benefits for you and your family - Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k and more with  employee only  coverage paid 100% by Tommy John  Generous Paid Parental Leave Flexible Paid Time Off Policy Hybrid Work Environment  Tommy John Employee Discount Learning Opportunities  But, don't just take our word for it. Check out #WorkAtTommyJohn on Instagram for a behind the scenes look!

Job Details Description ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Process Improvement Recommends equipment, new concepts, and techniques to improve performance (safety, quality, productivity), simplify construction, reduce cost, and/or comply with changes in codes/regulations. Develops thorough understanding of all equipment, identifies machine deficiencies and develops solutions.  Supports and manages the transition from design into production, including any testing and training required for implementing new or changed designs.  Analyzes issues/data using root cause analysis, identifies opportunities, and designs equipment, processes, and layouts to improve product quality, increase capacity, reduce safety risks, and delivery to best meet customer needs. Improves manufacturing processes by assisting with the design and modification of equipment and components. Plans, designs, and manages engineering solutions that meet all safety, quality, financial, cGMP and other regulatory requirements.  Works with other departments to develop and/or update Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s), process documentation and training materials to support new or modified processes and equipment. Assists with training employees in new and modified processes and equipment.  Uses metrics, lean manufacturing and other continuous improvement methods to problem solve and identify inefficiencies and solutions within manufacturing and other operational areas.  Prepares general arrangement, elevation and sectional drawings showing proposed new installations of equipment, ductwork, piping, etc. Designs fixtures, tooling, hoppers, or other job aids to improve manufacturing processes by seeking input from operations personnel. Prepares sketches/drawings for fabrication. Provides technical support for operations personnel to resolve technical problems. Troubleshooting And Capital Projects Leads, coordinates and manages complex engineering and capital improvement projects. Develops engineering project objectives; determines and assigns project responsibilities; and successfully executes project schedule by utilizing good project management methods/tools and resolving problems to deliver projects on time and within budget. Manages all project functions including designing, planning requirements with internal customers, managing project schedules, identifying risks, costs, and budgets. Monitors performance of equipment, machines and tools. Troubleshoots, investigates and resolves manufacturing design and process issues as they arise while driving towards root cause analysis in a cross-functional team environment.  Applies knowledge of mechanical engineering principles to determine equipment malfunctions and applies skills in restoring equipment to operation. Confers with vendors to determine product specifications and arranges for purchase of equipment, materials, or parts, and evaluates products according to specifications and quality standards. Prepares work orders when installation can be accomplished internally by internal resources.  Ensures effective communication and coordination on projects between stakeholders and project participants. Ensures projects comply with all safety, GMP, and other relevant regulatory and internal company requirements. SAFETY RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENT Supports a culture of safe production and operations; follows all safety rules and procedures. Actively participates in the safety program by engaging in training activities to learn what constitutes a safety hazard; reporting safety concerns to the supervisor; submitting safety suggestions; and correcting or reporting to the appropriate people when employee sees a workplace health or safety hazard, until it is resolved. Assists with communicating safety information to new employees. Fulfills responsibilities as outlined in the company safety management plan. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION And/or EXPERIENCE B.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering (B.S.M.E.) or related discipline and four to seven years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. Proficient in AutoCAD, Microsoft Word, and Excel. Experience in continuous improvement and GMP’s required. COMPENTENCIES Safety Management - Considers the impact on safety when making decisions. Acts with Integrity – Demonstrates responsible, ethical and honest behavior and models NOW’s core values. Attention to Detail - Ability to work accurately with attention to detail. Continuous Improvement - High level of adaptability and history of improving business results through accountability and cost management.  Communicates Proactively and Effectively – Ability to clearly convey ideas and concepts verbally and in writing. Keeps others informed and listens to input and feedback. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Customer-Driven – Servant minded leader in which excellent service is provided to all customers and sees business through the eyes of the customer.  Decision Making and Planning - Ability to make sound decisions independently. Flexibility – Ability to prioritize and to shift directions as business needs require. Maintains a positive attitude and high quality workload. Must be able to work a flexible schedule, including off shifts and weekends.  Problem-Solving – Reacts quickly and appropriately to opportunities and problems and makes sound decisions. Follows up in a timely manner to issues not immediately resolved. Advanced problem solving and analytical ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues while driving towards root cause analysis.  Project Management – Ability to develop project objectives and successfully execute project schedule by utilizing good project management methods/tools and resolving problems to deliver projects on time and within budget. Results Driven – Self-driven and motivated to accomplish objectives in a fast-paced environment. Displays a sense of urgency to meet all business objectives Team Player - Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, inside and outside the unit and to work effectively both independently and as a team player. Technical - Ability to critically review and interpret technical documentation. Time Management - Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, inside and outside the unit. PHYSICAL DEMANDS  While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently works at a desk and communicates to employees, vendors and contractors. The employee is frequently required to move from place to place within the facility and to travel to multiple facilities. WORK ENVIRONMENT  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to herbal aromas, dust, and/or airborne particles.

job_title: Digital Factory - Senior Developer and DevOps Engineer

Our client is a well-established and growing AIFM based in Luxembourg City Center. They manage a broad multi-asset portfolio across PE/RE/Infrastructure and have over 15 staff in the office. In line with growth they are looking to hire a new Senior AML/KYC Analyst on a full-time basis. About Pinterest : Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet. Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. As you read through the expectations of the position, consider how your skills and experiences may complement the responsibilities of the role. We encourage you to think through your relevant and transferable skills from prior experiences. Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our  PinFlex  landing page to learn more.  We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Marketing org. As a Senior Data Scientist you introduce greater scientific rigor into the marketing measurement and optimization processes to shape Pinterest’s user growth and marketing strategy. The results of your work will influence and drive strategic decisions for the company - identify investment opportunities for growth, understand user growth and behavior, and define metrics to grow and sustain our user base. You will collaborate on a wide array of business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Marketing, Product, Engineering, Design, Research, Product Analytics, Data Engineering and others. What You’ll Do: Deep strategic analysis to answer growth marketing ecosystem questions such as how to drive monthly active users from paid performance marketing, how to quantify the effect of paid performance marketing in new markets, how to drive user engagement and user LTV (lifetime value) from performance marketing. Evolve our existing systems like geo-testing frameworks and other incrementality testing frameworks. Develop new statistical models as well as maintain/improve existing models like user lifetime value models, budgeting models, long term user retention models etc. Collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Analytics, Marketing, Data Engineering and others. Evolve our experimentation capabilities and tools to evaluate the business impact of performance marketing investment. Advise on experimentation best practices; identifying flaws in experiment practices and results; building tools for experiment analysis; etc.  Identify the right measures of success for teams and help them track those metrics. Own the full lifecycle of those metrics from logging requirements, metrics definition, prototype pipelines, and improvements.  Come up with recommendations for marketing leadership on how we can evolve our internal strategy to address shortcomings, and how we can increase ROI from marketing investments. Write clear, actionable analyses that help teams uncover opportunities and identify areas of improvement to our existing strategies.  What We’re Looking For: 5+ years of combined post-graduate academic and industry experience applying scientific methods to solve real-world problems. Proven ability to apply scientific methods to solve real-world problems. Expertise in at least one scripting language (ideally Python/R). Proficiency in SQL/Hive. Ability to write efficient SQL queries. Strong business and product sense. Strong skills in shaping vague questions into well-defined analyses and success metrics that drive business decisions. Excellent communication skills, able to lead initiatives and communicate findings to the leadership and cross-functional teams. Explains work and thought processes clearly and concisely. Experience leading key technical projects. Strong Experimentation background. Statistical rigor. Experience with causal inference projects. Relocation Statement:  This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model. At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise. Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found here. US based applicants only $123,470—$254,024 USD Our Commitment To Diversity: Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. DataVisor is the world’s leading AI-powered Fraud and Risk Platform that delivers the best overall detection coverage in the industry. With an open SaaS platform that supports easy consolidation and enrichment of any data, DataVisor's solution scales infinitely and enables organizations to act on fast-evolving fraud and money laundering activities in real time. Its patented unsupervised machine learning technology, advanced device intelligence, powerful decision engine and investigation tools work together to provide guaranteed performance lift from day one. DataVisor's platform is architected to support multiple use cases across different business units flexibly, dramatically lowering the total cost of ownership, compared to legacy point solutions. DataVisor is recognized as an industry leader and has been adopted by many Fortune 500 companies across the globe. Our award-winning software platform is powered by a team of world-class experts in big data, machine learning, security, and scalable infrastructure. Our culture is open, positive, collaborative, and results driven. Come join us! Summary: As platform engineers, we are building a next-generation machine learning platform, which incorporates our secret sauce, UML (unsupervised machine learning) with other SML (supervised machine learning) algorithms. Our team works to improve our core detection algorithms and automate the full training process. As complex fraud attacks become more prevalent, it is more important than ever to detect fraudsters in real-time. The platform team is responsible for developing the architecture that makes real-time UML possible. We are looking for creative and eager engineers to help us expand our novel streaming and database systems, which enable our detection capabilities. We continue to push the boundary of what's possible in fraud detection and data processing at scale. Join us to help usher in more innovative solutions to the fraud detection space. What you'll do: Design and build machine learning systems that process data sets from the world’s largest consumer services Use unsupervised machine learning, supervised machine learning, and deep learning to detect fraudulent behavior and catch fraudsters Build and optimize systems, tools, and validation strategies to support new features Help design/build distributed real-time systems and features Use big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra) to build large scale machine learning pipelines Develop new systems on top of real-time streaming technologies (e.g. Kafka, Flink) Requirements 0-3years software development experience 2 years experience in Java, Shell, Python development Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL and ORM technologies (JPA2, Hibernate) is a plus Experience in Cassandra, HBase, Flink, Spark or Kafka is a plus Experience in the Spring Framework is a plus Experience with test-driven development is a plus Benefits Canada Life Policy Health Insurance including (Extended Health Care, Vision Care, and Dental Care) Life Insurance, Accidental Insurance Retirement Savings Plan Paid Vacation

Job Description Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International? Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride. You will help our business react to changing business conditions with excellent data analysis. You will define the requirements, perform the analysis and identify patterns in large amounts of data. How You Will Contribute You will: Define requirements for analysis in a given business area and perform detailed analysis and identify trends defined in the requirements Identify patterns and help the business react to changing business conditions Perform root-cause analysis and interpret data Work with large amounts of data such as facts, figures, and mathematics/formulas and undertake analytical activities and delivers analysis outputs in accordance with customer needs and conforming to established standards Understand and be involved with aspects of the data science process As the investigator on the data science team, you will apply your knowledge of languages and pull data out of SQL databases, using Tableau/Power BI type tools, and producing basic data visualizations and reporting dashboards What You Will Bring A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Power BI, SQL,R, Python, SAS software, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Tableau, Google AdWords, statistical software Moderate knowledge in math and statistical skills, strong business acumen, moderate computer science/coding skills Develop key performance indicators and create visualizations of the data Utilize business intelligence and analytics tool This position provides a very significant amount of learning and growth opportunities from both technical and leadership perspective. The candidate will be exposed to different areas of Machine Learning Operations and Maintenance and will manage a variety of modeling approaches. Education / Certifications: Degree in the fields of Computer Science, Engineering, Computational Statistics, or Mathematics. Job specific requirements: Design, build and optimize application containerization and orchestration with Docker and Google Kubernetes Engine. Design, build and deployed microservices for Data Science application such as ML Training Pipeline, ML Serving Pipeline. Leverage your proficiency with Continuous Implementation and Continuous Delivery to deploy code into production. Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Model Validation process developed by Data Science and Analytics team and implement the Model validation process pipeline in compliance with company policy. Work in agile pods to design and build cloud hosted, ML products with automated pipelines that run, monitor, and retrain ML Models. Build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack. Set up the ML Model Reports on usage of models, model performance monitoring. Become a core member of the Model Governance Team related to new model development and validation. What extra ingredients you will bring: 8+ year of experience as DevOps, Data Engineer, and Machine Learning Engineer working on cloud-based services on Unix/Linux environment. Experience in a variety of fields such as DevOps, Data Engineering, and Machine Learning Operations. Previous experience deploying machine learning services and applications to at least one major cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP) using Python and PySpark onto the Databricks environment. Knowledge on machine learning frameworks like Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras etc. Proficiency with MLOps frameworks like MLFlow, Kubeflow, ML Tracking and Experiments. Experience in working with source code management systems like GitHub. Ability to enable the Data and Model Drift Alert Framework. Experience setting up the version control on Code, Data, and Machine Learning Models and recommend ideas to improve the Model performance. Ability to provide effective challenge to the model design, development and conduct incremental analysis and testing as necessary. Review of back-testing exercises produced by the Modeling team. Validation of methodological choices and contribution as an expert to the model review. A working knowledge of exact, approximation algorithms, and heuristic methods for solving difficult optimization problems. Experience implementing and maintaining model validation processes and conducting validation / ongoing monitoring activities for new and existing models. Ability to provide assessments by writing a comprehensive validation report based on your evaluation of the Model results. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary With several brands that are among consumer favourites, including Cadbury, OREO, Christie and Maynards, we are one of the largest snack companies in Canada. Many of our iconic brands are ranked first, second or third in their categories, and our manufacturers and pastry chefs have an enviable mission to create and manufacture chocolate, cookies, crackers and candy in our iconic factories and locations across Ontario. A company with many ambitious growth targets, we have invested close to $250 million in our Ontario plants in recent years alone; We run marketing campaigns promoting innovative products such as Cadbury Dark Milk tablets and OREO Birthday Cake and Peppermint Bark cookies. Our community of more than 2,683 employees is present across Canada and our head office is in Toronto. Passion and dedication characterize our Company. We encourage all our employees to be themselves at work, to speak out and to encourage diversity in all areas of activity. In addition, we foster a flexible work environment and place great importance on the notions of trust and empathy to promote a true sense of belonging. Mondelez welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the selection process. job_title: Machine Learning Engineer I, ML (Anywhere ML)
job_description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Join the Affirm team as a Software Engineer and contribute to the success of our ML Underwriting team. We are the driving force behind Affirm's core value proposition, leveraging cutting-edge machine learning to assess creditworthiness throughout the life cycle of loan applications. As a Software Engineer on our team, you will be at the forefront of developing high-quality, production-ready models that play a central role in our decision-making processes. Your contributions will be instrumental in shaping our financial landscape. If you have a strong interest in machine learning and enjoy challenging work, Affirm is the place for you! What You'll Do Use Affirm’s proprietary and other third party data to develop machine learning models that predict the likelihood of default and make an approval or decline decision to achieve business objectives Partner with platform and product engineering teams to build model training, decisioning, and monitoring systems  Research ground breaking solutions and develop prototypes that drive the future of credit decisioning at Affirm Implement and scale data pipelines, new features, and algorithms that are essential to our production models Collaborate with the engineering, credit, and product teams to define requirements for new products What We Look For Proficiency in machine learning with experience in areas such as Generalized Linear Models, Gradient Boosting, Deep Learning, and Probabilistic Calibration. Domain knowledge in credit risk is a plus Strong programming skills in Python and SQL Experience using large scale distributed systems like Spark or Ray is a plus Experience using open source projects and software such as scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, XGBoost, Kubeflow is a plus Excellent written and oral communication skills and the capability to drive cross-functional requirements with product and engineering teams The ability to present technical concepts and results in an audience-appropriate way Persistence, patience and a strong sense of responsibility – we build the decision making that enables consumers and partners to place their trust in Affirm! Pay Grade  - CAN 28 Employees new to Affirm or promoted into a new role, typically begin in the min to mid range. CAN Base Pay Range Per Year Min: $91,800 Mid: $112,500 Max: $133,100 Location - Remote Canada Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and you can work almost anywhere within the country of employment. Affirmers in proximal roles have the flexibility to work remotely, but will occasionally be required to work out of their assigned Affirm office. A limited number of roles remain office-based due to the nature of their job responsibilities. Benefits We’re extremely proud to offer competitive benefits that are anchored to our core value of people come first. Some key highlights of our benefits package include:  Health care coverage - Affirm covers all premiums for all levels of coverage for you and your dependents   Flexible Spending Wallets - generous stipends for spending on Technology, Food, various Lifestyle needs, and family forming expenses   Time off - competitive vacation and holiday schedules allowing you to take time off to rest and recharge   ESPP - An employee stock purchase plan enabling you to buy shares of Affirm at a discount  We believe It’s On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process. [For U.S. positions that could be performed in Los Angeles or San Francisco] Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, Affirm will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy for applicants within the United States, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Poland) for applicants applying from Poland, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Spain) for applicants applying from Spain, or the Affirm U.K. Limited Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data for applicants applying from the United Kingdom, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

Job Description: General Summary Researches, designs, develops, and tests systems-level software and/or hardware. Designs and coordinates complex engineering projects at the system level. Performs functional decomposition to drive requirements and specifications to both hardware and software. Analyzes information to determine, recommend, and plan installation of a new system or modification of an existing system. Ensures system-level performance and power metrics are met. Drives triage of problems at the system level to determine root cause. The Display Processing Unit (DPU) is responsible for the conversion, color management and compositing of image streams from other blocks, such as the GPU, CPU, video decoder and camera. It formats, packetizes and synchronizes the composited image for display through display interfaces such as display port, USB-C. DPU functional model is used to develop and analyze display features for the best image quality at lower cost. Chip power and performance for key usage cases is a critical determinant of competitive advantage. As such, performance analysis and power estimates receive high levels of attention throughout the organization. The responsibilities of this role include: Support, maintain and improve the display functional modeling infrastructure. Work with display system, hardware and software teams to integrate, develop and validate display features. Integrate/develop System C TLM models of DPU in the full system TLM SoC platform for performance evaluation and analysis. Develop and integrate components in the display performance platform. Perform performance analysis and correlation with the RTL. Present analysis results and provide recommendations. Working with the display team power prime and provide DPU power models as the modules evolve in architecture and silicon technology. At various points in the DPU design cycle, from early concept to final silicon realization, models of differing complexity / accuracy are required. Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. C/C++ programming, scripting, Linux and windows environment. Excel modelling Version control software such as git, clearcase Strong presentation and communication skills Strong analytical, and time management skills. Methodical, data oriented, detail oriented Self-motivating . Preferred Qualifications Strong background in display system and SoC memory architecture. Exposure to performance simulators (event & cycle driven modeling) and performance correlation Performance benchmark/workload analysis and characterization. Understanding of what factors drive SoC power consumption at architectural / block level. Grasp and abstraction of complex architectures and usage scenarios. Comments for Suppliers: - wfh position until the wfh order has been lifted

Job Description The Advanced Technology Group (ATG) at ServiceNow is a customer-focused innovation group building intelligent software and smart user experiences using existing and latest advanced technologies to enable end-to-end, industry-leading work experiences for customers. We are a group of researchers, applied scientists, engineers, and product managers with a dual mission. We build and evolve the AI platform, and partner with teams to build products and end-to-end AI-powered work experiences. In equal measure, we lay the foundations, research, experiment, and de-risk AI technologies that unlock new work experiences in the future. You will play a major part in building AI and Machine Learning (ML) solutions that transform the user experience and workflow efficiency of enterprise services. Traditional analytical tools tend to require a technically knowledgeable user to produce even simple results. We are taking a completely fresh approach with the expectation that any user, regardless of technical knowledge, can use the AI/ML solutions we develop to operate the services in the enterprise setting in a thoughtful and scalable manner. We are just getting started with our early-adopter customers and we need your help in building and making available an amazing range of solutions to our 5k+ enterprise customers around the world. Build the best cloud-based AI/ML solutions to power intelligent enterprise services  Collaborate daily with a team of like-minded developers, product managers and quality engineers to produce quality software  Work with product owners to understand detailed requirements and own your code from design, implementation, testing and delivery of high-quality solutions to our users  Qualifications To be successful in this role you have: Currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Applied Sciences, or a related field.  Graduating December 2024, or later  Able to work full time for approx. 16-weeks (4 months) during 2024 (May – August or June - September)   Experience in Python/Java programming, OOP, Design Patterns, time and space-efficient algorithms  Experience and interest for computer infrastructure, large-scale distributed systems, reliability and observability  Expertise in coding efficient, object-oriented, modularized and quality software  Knowledge of core AI/ML techniques and algorithms  Knowledge of unit testing, profiling, and code tuning  Additional Information Le Groupe de Technologie Avancée (ATG) chez ServiceNow est un groupe d'innovation axé sur le client qui construit des logiciels intelligents et des expériences utilisateur performantes en utilisant les technologies avancées existantes et les plus récentes pour permettre des expériences de travail leader dans l'industrie de bout en bout pour nos clients. Nous sommes un groupe de chercheurs, de scientifiques appliqués, d'ingénieurs et de chefs de produit avec une double mission. Nous construisons et faisons évoluer la plateforme IA et collaborons avec des équipes pour construire des produits et des expériences de travail alimentées par l'IA de bout en bout. Dans une mesure égale, nous posons les bases, faisons de la recherche, expérimentons et réduisons les risques des technologies IA qui déverrouillent de nouvelles expériences de travail à l'avenir. Vous jouerez un rôle majeur dans la construction de solutions IA et d'Apprentissage Automatique (ML) qui transforment l'expérience utilisateur et l'efficacité des workflows des services d'entreprise. Les outils analytiques traditionnels ont tendance à nécessiter un utilisateur techniquement compétent pour produire même des résultats simples. Nous adoptons une approche entièrement nouvelle avec l'attente que tout utilisateur, quelles que soient ses connaissances techniques, puisse utiliser les solutions IA/ML que nous développons pour gérer les services dans un cadre d'entreprise de manière réfléchie et évolutive. Nous ne faisons que commencer avec nos premiers clients adoptants et nous avons besoin de votre aide pour construire et mettre à disposition une gamme incroyable de solutions pour nos plus de 5 000 clients d'entreprise à travers le monde.  Construisez les meilleures solutions AI/ML basées sur le cloud pour alimenter les services d'entreprise intelligents  Collaborez quotidiennement avec une équipe de développeurs, de chefs de produit et d'ingénieurs qualité partageant les mêmes idées pour produire un logiciel de qualité  Travaillez avec les propriétaires de produits pour comprendre les exigences détaillées et prenez en charge votre code, de la conception, la mise en œuvre, les tests et la livraison de solutions de haute qualité à nos utilisateurs Compétences recherchées:  Inscrit à un programme de baccalauréat (ingénierie ou informatique) En cours d'obtention d'un diplôme de baccalauréat ou maîtrise en informatique, génie, ou dans tout autre domaine pertinent  Graduation prévue en décembre 2024, ou plus tard  En mesure de travailler à temps plein pendant environ 16 semaines (4 mois) au cours d'un trimestre en 2024   Expérience de développement (Python/Java), programmation OO, conception de logiciels, algorithmie  Intérêt pour l’infrastructure informatique, les systèmes distribuées à grande échelle, l’observabilité  Connaissance des techniques et algorithmes principaux de l'IA/ML  Connaissance des tests unitaires, du profilage et de l'optimisation du code.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will assume a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting extensive datasets pertaining to our customer base, payment systems, pricing, logistics, and customer cohorts. Your insights and recommendations will be instrumental in optimizing our ecommerce operations and elevating customer experiences. Candidates should possess a well-established background in data science, exceptional project management skills, effective communication abilities, and the drive to achieve results in a dynamic environment. An affinity for delving into complex problems and a focus on metrics to define objectives, measure progress, and attain goals is essential. Responsibilities: Data Analysis and Modeling: Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to extract insights from extensive datasets, identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies related to customer behavior, payment systems, pricing strategies, logistics, and customer cohorts. Ecommerce Optimization: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders, to formulate data-driven strategies fostering ecommerce growth, improving customer satisfaction, and increasing revenue. Provide recommendations for A/B testing, personalization, and targeted marketing campaigns. AI-Driven Reporting Tools: Leverage expertise in the latest AI-driven reporting tools to create scalable and automated solutions for analyzing and visualizing data. Develop insightful dashboards, reports, and metrics offering actionable insights to various stakeholders. Data Engineering: Work closely with data engineers to enhance data pipelines, ensuring efficient and accurate data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes. Proficiency in tools such as Spark and Redshift is necessary for processing and analyzing large datasets. Statistical Analysis and Modeling: Apply advanced statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to construct predictive models and algorithms driving business decisions. Develop models for customer segmentation, churn prediction, and pricing optimization to enhance business outcomes. Communication and Collaboration: Effectively communicate complex data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align business objectives with data science initiatives, driving actionable outcomes. Qualifications: A Master's or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative field (Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related). 5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, emphasizing ecommerce and large customer bases. Proficiency in Python for data analysis, modeling, and visualization. Expertise in storing and retrieving data in relational databases, with highly proficient SQL skills. Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and predictive modeling. Deep understanding of ecommerce operations, including customer behavior, marketing strategies, and revenue optimization. Excellent verbal and written communication skills for presenting complex data-driven insights. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a knack for proposing innovative solutions to complex challenges. Ability to discern when data can't be trusted and dive deep to determine causes of data corruption. Nice to haves: Experience with the AWS tech stack (S3, Airflow, Sagemaker, Lambda). Familiarity with ETL tools such as Airflow and DBT. Experience with best practices for deploying and maintaining models. If you are a passionate data scientist with a robust ecommerce background, adept at uncovering valuable insights, and eager to contribute significantly to a rapidly growing company, we invite you to reach out. Join our team and help shape the future of our ecommerce operations through data-driven decision-making.

job_title: Data Scientist, Translational Data Science (Principal Scientist)
job_description:
We are seeking a highly motivated, flexible hands-on Data Scientist (Principal Scientist) to join our growing Translational Data Science team within the Translational Medicine organization. You will be at the center of our desire to use clinical, biomarker, and single cell data to bring forward new medicines in autoimmune disease and cancer. You will leverage your creativity and analytical thinking to develop and to apply computational methods and AI/ML techniques to advance both our clinical and research programs. Your work will help us gain actionable insight from our high dimensional and multi-modal data and assess our biotherapeutics’ ability to modulate the immune repertoire. This is an on-site position in Cambridge, MA. What you will do: Synthesize our data into actionable insights by supplying to the Translational teams any needed computational, statistical, machine learning or modeling capabilities needed to advance our clinical programs. Examples include: Computational strategies for disease endotyping from back-translational studies to identify and rank indications for first in-human-studies as well as identify actionable targets/combinations.  Identification and qualification of biomarkers (e.g., selection, PD, efficacy biomarkers) and analysis of data from both our clinical and research effects  Assessment of treatment effects from both RNA (e.g., bulk, single cell, TCR/BCR, and spatial) and protein modalities (e.g., CITE/REAP-Seq, mIF, and high dimensional flow cytometry  Develop and apply computational, AI/ML methods to analyze our multi-modal data. Examples include: Best practices for single cell methods including data imputation and normalization, bulk deconvolution, cell type/state analysis, cell-cell interaction/trajectory inference, reconstruction of cell type specific interactomes – cellphoneDB and spatial transcriptomic analysis and visualization  Pipelines for data processing and QC including visualization and integrative analysis (e.g., Nextflow, Python, shell scripts) including but not limited to quality control, alignment, variant calling, annotation, deconvolution, etc.  Generative AI models to integrate and to analyze multi-modal molecular as well as patient clinical data  Interactive dashboards for data visualization and interpretation  What you will bring:  Ph.D. in a computational, statistical, biophysics, or bioinformatics related fields   A minimum of 5-years research (academia or industry) experience  First-hand experience in single cell sequencing analysis and data generation methods as well as the computing infrastructure and data management methods  First-hand multi-parametric data mining experience for disease endotyping, target identification and biomarker analysis. For example, multivariate analysis; dimensionality reduction methods; parametric and non-parametric statistical methods; Bayesian statistics; pattern recognition or classification methods  Expert level fluency in statistical programming using Python, R/bioconductor or equivalents.  Demonstrated ability to lead projects of moderate scope, mapping-out critical path, milestones and timelines, as well as manage expectations with minimal supervision.   Demonstrated experience in deep learning and generative AI model assessment is a differentiator.  Curiosity to dive below the surface and proactively identify critical issues including their tactical and strategic resolutions.  Excellent oral and written communication  Benefits we offer:  HiFiBiO is committed to the health and well-being of our team members and offers a variety of benefits supporting our diverse employee base. All full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits package: Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance (Company covers 80% of the premium cost)  Life, AD&D, Short-term, and Long-term Disability Insurance (100% company covers)  Health Savings Account & Flexible Spending Account  Telehealth Service (100% company covers)  Dependent Care Pre-tax Account  Parking and Commuter Pre-tax Account Unlimited PTO (Paid Time Off) 10 Paid Holidays and Sick Time (40 hours per year)  401(K) Plan  Equal Opportunity Employer We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants and employees are considered for positions and evaluated without regard to mental or physical disability, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, marital status or any other protected Federal/National, State/Province, or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved. Notice to Search Firms/Third-Party Recruitment Agencies (Recruiters) Our Human Resources team manages the recruitment and employment process for HiFiBiO Therapeutics. To protect the interests of all parties involved, HiFiBiO will only accept resumes from a recruiter if an executed search agreement directed to the particular position(s) is in place. Unsolicited resumes sent to HiFiBiO from recruiters do not constitute any type of relationship between the recruiter and HiFiBiO and do not obligate HiFiBiO in any way to pay any fees should we hire from those resumes. Recruiters are requested not to contact or present candidates directly to our hiring manager or employees; no response will be provided to such contact or presentation. About HiFiBiO Therapeutics HiFiBiO is a clinical stage biotech company advancing a robust pipeline targeting both innate and adaptive immunity to treat cancer and autoimmune disease. Our proprietary and versatile DIS™ single-cell platform enables the rapid discovery of novel antibody therapeutics and predictive biomarkers through our internal development programs and strategic collaborations. Our passionate team across three continents embraces a fast-paced and engaging work environment to bring transformative medicines to patients. Data Scientist (hybrid) About Us Based in Chesapeake, VA, Dollar Tree, Inc. operates more than 16,000 stores across the 48 contiguous states and five Canadian provinces, supported by a coast-to-coast logistics network and more than 210,000 associates. With two iconic brands, Dollar Tree and Family Dollar, and a history of opening hundreds of stores each year, the company has grown its store formats to serve customers in all types of geographic markets. Come help us grow! THE OPPORTUNITY This role, which is part of the Real Estate Market Strategy team, is for an experienced data scientist who desires end to end ownership and accountability in developing analytics-based solutions that will create new avenues for profitable, efficient real estate decision making. The position will serve as a key player in growing our Dollar Tree and Family Dollar store base and analyzing our existing fleet of 16,000+ stores in North America by leading the analyses in support of Dollar Tree’s store growth and renovation objectives and developing and executing the strategic initiatives to support them. The Data Scientist will offer a modern and thoughtful approach to data analysis and bring strength in developing and operationalizing a data science/data analytics roadmap of compelling initiatives that accelerate the company’s growth agenda, advance Dollar Tree’s business objectives, and contribute to EBITDA and operating income improvements. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Engage with variety of business stakeholders to apply knowledge of statistics, machine learning, and AI capabilities to identify growth areas, new and emerging opportunities for improvement, and to optimize real estate location analytics for both new and existing stores Execute full project life cycle through project planning, data collection, model prototyping and deployment, and measuring outcomes, with responsibilities encompassing stakeholder management and communication to cross-functional partners. Bring synergy between machine learning, AI, and retail real estate functions by understanding organization goals, strategies, current practices, and areas of opportunity. Recommend strategies by evaluating organization objectives, identifying problems, evaluating trends, and anticipating requirements. Develop and implement advanced analytics solutions (predictive, prescriptive models, machine learning algorithms, AI models) to support and optimize business outcomes. Specific models include, but are not limited to, sales projection models, cannibalization models, and profitability models. Develop various advanced analytical initiatives to support key strategic priorities, such as store growth and existing fleet optimization. Define objectives and key milestones to meet short and long-term needs of business stakeholders and oversee project management activities such as team communication, leadership updates, stakeholder management, and timelines. Develop and maintain relationships with wide range of stakeholders including business partners, IT, and other data analytic teams. Interact with stakeholders and management to share progress and to gain acceptance of machine learning and AI technology and resulting business solutions. Present and share highly complex information related to initiatives to both peers and executive level stakeholders in a clear and concise manner as to be meaningful to those that may not be familiar with data science.  Stay up to date on new machine learning techniques and approaches to data science Minimum Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field 8+ years of experience in data science, AI, analytics, statistics, or related field Excellent written and oral communication and data presentation skills with ability to communicate technical concepts and solutions to business partners from various technical backgrounds, as well as stakeholders who are not necessarily familiar with data science. Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Strong Data Science and Machine Learning Skills with a deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques.  Proficient in data science programming languages (Python and R) and experience with SQL and relational databases Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint  Knowledgeable in AI governance principles and an understanding of ethical considerations to ensure responsible use of data and AI. Detail-oriented with excellent problem-solving skills and ability to translate business problems across disciplines into advanced analytic projects with measurable business value Passionate about data science and AI and committed to continuous learning, remaining up to date with the latest developments in the field, and continuously improving skills and knowledge Must be an independent thinker with the ability to work under minimal supervision and to thrive in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple projects and tight deadlines. Preferred Qualifications: Master’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field Retail experience Real Estate Site Selection experience Familiarity with Esri or other GIS software and spatial analytics Experience with Geospatial AI (GeoAI) Previous experience leading/supervising teams

Overview You’ll be part of a central data science at Atlassian, responsible for ensuring metrics consistency between operational teams and executive level business reporting. Responsibilities Collaborate on a variety of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners and become a trusted strategic partner through the structure and clarity of your work. You’ll work with other data scientists, analysts, engineers, and fraud operators to guide strategies and achieve KPIs while communicating your insights with leaders across the organization. decision trees and A/B test models, identify leading indicators of fraud losses, and develop strategies to improve fraud capture rates  Design, build and enhance dimensional models for BI solutions dictionary and process documentation Research new tools and technologies to improve existing processes Minimum Qualifications 4+ years experience in data analytics, strategy analytics or modeling role communication This role may require on-call rotations Preferred Qualifications Proficient in Developing LookML Knowledge and experience of financial markets, banking or exchanges Experience working in small firms or start up technology first It Pays to Work Here The Compensation & Benefits Package For This Role Includes Competitive starting salary A discretionary annual bonus Long-term incentive in range for this role is between $120,000 - $168,000 in the State of New York, the State of California and the State of Washington. Overview:  We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Research Scientist to join our dynamic team focused on providing customized research services related to microscopy and proteomic preparation. This role includes the exciting opportunity to establish a new laboratory in Boston. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in designing and executing customized research projects, setting up the Boston lab, and providing expertise in microscopy and proteomic techniques.   Responsibilities: Customized Research Design: Collaborate with clients to understand and tailor research requirements. Design and propose customized research strategies, considering microscopy and proteomic aspects. Provide strategic guidance on experimental design, sample preparation, and data analysis. Lab Setup: Lead the establishment of a new laboratory facility in Boston, ensuring compliance with safety and regulatory standards. Procure necessary equipment, reagents, and consumables for the laboratory. Collaborate with vendors to set up service contracts and maintenance schedules. Microscopy and Proteomic Expertise: Utilize advanced microscopy techniques – the Microscoop to investigate subcellular components, and biological processes. Operate and maintain state-of-the-art microscopy equipment. Troubleshoot technical issues and optimize imaging protocols for diverse sample types. Conduct proteomic sample preparation, including protein extraction, purification, and quantification. Ensure adherence to quality control standards in proteomic workflows. Data Acquisition and Analysis: Analyze and interpret experimental data, providing insightful conclusions and recommendations. Collaborate with bioinformaticians for in-depth data analysis when necessary. Ensure rigorous data analysis, interpretation, and documentation. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and detailed laboratory records. Prepare comprehensive reports and contribute to scientific publications. Present findings at internal meetings, conferences, and client interactions. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams and research collaborators. Communicate effectively with clients and collaborators. Foster a collaborative and innovative research environment. Qualifications: Ph.D. in a relevant field (e.g., Biology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology, or related discipline). Extensive experience in microscopy techniques and proteomic sample preparation. Familiarity with laboratory setup and equipment procurement. Willingness to travel occasionally to Taiwan for training purposes. Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills. Experience: 3+ years of post-Ph.D. research experience in a related field. Track record of successful execution of customized research projects. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Comprehensive benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement. Contribution to the establishment and growth of a cutting-edge research facility. If you are passionate about advancing scientific research, possess the necessary skills, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to groundbreaking discoveries through customized research services.

You will be responsible for eliciting, analyzing, specifying and validating the business needs of project stakeholders, as well as devising and designing business process requirements to support maximizing business systems’ effectiveness and efficiency. The Closer: What you bring A hunter who is highly driven and self-motivated to be successful in what you do Martech experience within a Fortune 500 company A track record of driving new business through prospecting, outbound lead generation and closing sales Enterprise-wide sales experience with consistent and demonstrable C-level engagements Proven record of consistent over achievement of quota in a SaaS environment Expertise at leveraging multiple social channels (LinkedIn, Twitter, events, etc.) to make connections and start conversations with people Exceptional presentation skills Experience prospecting, nurturing and pipeline building using tools like Salesforce.com, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Hootsuite, etc. Writing, crafting and honing engaging and attention-grabbing emails, proposals, letters and voice messages Polished and articulate, with a finesse in getting your message across easily Collaborative: You naturally share ideas and never lose sight that you are part of a team Adept at coaching and mentoring others toward success Agile: Able to adapt to change and flourish in a dynamic environment A positive person with the ability to excel under pressure Show me the Money In addition to the above, our ideal candidate is a mature, intelligent, articulate and highly motivated individual with a high degree of business acumen, social intelligence and an inherent swagger for selling. You are confident, not arrogant and thrive in a fast-paced, customer-focused, relationship-led environment and are willing to go the distance. The ROI: What’s in it for you? Vision Critical provides customer relationship intelligence software that improves customer relationships to grow customer lifetime value. Designed for today’s always-on, social and mobile savvy customer, Vision Critical’s technology helps large, customer-centric enterprises discover what their customers want so they can deliver what they need. Unlike traditional customer research, which is slow, expensive and gathers dust on a shelf, Vision Critical’s customer intelligence platform replaces static data and cumbersome reports with real-time actionable customer intelligence that companies need to build better products, deliver better services and achieve better business outcomes. Hundreds of high-performance organizations use Vision Critical’s technology. Follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/visioncritical. Ready for the challenge? job_title: Senior Développeur Fullstack Java / Angular Confirmé
job_description:
Nous recherchons un développeur Fullstack Java / Angular Confirmé ayant au moins 5 ans d'expérience pour rejoindre notre équipe . Le candidat retenu travaillera sur le développement de fonctionnalités à la fois front-end et back-end pour des applications Web et des API en utilisant Java et Angular. Le candidat doit être en mesure d'analyser les exigences des clients, concevoir des architectures logicielles, développer des fonctionnalités, effectuer des tests et travailler en collaboration avec les autres membres de l'équipe pour assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des logiciels développés. Responsabilités : Analyser les besoins des clients pour comprendre les exigences fonctionnelles et techniques des projets de développement Concevoir des architectures logicielles pour des applications Web et des API, en utilisant des technologies telles que Spring, Hibernate et JPA Développer des fonctionnalités front-end pour des applications Web en utilisant Angular, HTML, CSS et JavaScript Développer des fonctionnalités back-end en utilisant Java, Spring, Hibernate, JPA et SQL pour les bases de données Écrire des tests unitaires pour garantir la qualité du code et la fiabilité des fonctionnalités Participer à la revue de code pour assurer la qualité et la cohérence du code développé Collaborer avec les autres membres de l'équipe, y compris les UX/UI designers, les chefs de projet et les testeurs pour assurer une coordination efficace du développement de logiciels Documenter le code, les fonctionnalités et les configurations pour faciliter la maintenance et l'évolutivité du code Surveiller les performances de l'application et effectuer des optimisations en cas de besoin Se tenir à jour avec les dernières technologies, tendances et bonnes pratiques en matière de développement pour améliorer la qualité et l'efficacité du travail Requirements Vous avez un minimum 5 ans d'expérience en développement fullstack avec Java et Angular  Vous avez développé des tests unitaires, appliqué du TDD et du BDD Vous avez utilisé GIT et fait de l'intégration continue avec GitLab, Github ou Jenkins Vous êtes communicant(e), curieux(se), désireux(se) travailler en équipe et partager avec des collègues experts Vous souhaitez monter en compétence et apprendre Vous cherchez des missions techniques, passionnantes et à la page Diplôme en informatique, génie logiciel ou équivalent L’Anglais et le Français sont obligatoires Benefits Permanent contract, Dynamic and innovation environment, Trainings, Competitive salary package

Sopra Steria,  l’un des leaders européens de la Tech reconnu pour ses activités de conseil, de services numériques et d’édition de logiciels, aide ses clients à mener leur transformation digitale. Fort de 47 000 collaborateurs dans près de 30 pays, le Groupe place l’humain au centre de son action pour construire un avenir positif. Avec plus de 30 familles de métiers, 11 secteurs d’activité, 6 filiales et 15 expertises reconnues, les parcours et les opportunités sont variés Nous offrons : Télétravail (en fonction de la mission et client) Équilibre vie privée – vie professionnelle Formations fournies par Sopra Steria Academy (+300 types de formations) Un package attractif (Voiture ou allocation voiture, carte essence, chèques repas, complémentaire retraite…) Mission : Définition de l'architecture technique des systèmes d'information : proposition de solutions techniques, veille technologique. Mise en place de solutions, gestion des incidents et intervention dans les projets pour résoudre les problèmes applicatifs. Participation aux évaluations de conformité et supervision de la mise en œuvre de la politique du groupe. Analyse des impacts techniques des nouvelles solutions et leur alignement avec l'architecture existante. Établissement et gestion des référentiels du système informatique (outils, procédures, normes, sécurité, terminologie) ainsi que des standards techniques Profil : Connaissances du secteur bancaire. Capacités d'analyse solides pour appréhender les systèmes en place et les analyses MOA. Maîtrise des outils bureautiques standards tels qu'Office et JIRA. Maîtrise des pratiques AGILES. Technologies attendues : Maîtrise du développement web avec Angular (au moins Angular 8). Excellente maîtrise des technologies de développement Java (au moins Java 8). Compétence avec Spring Boot, Hibernate et JPA, Webservices (Rest, Soap) et JavaEE. Connaissance des bases de données (PostgreSQL & Oracle). Préférence pour IntelliJ, Eclipse ou VS Code. Familiarité avec la Stack ELK (Elastic Search, Logstash et Kibana). Connaissance des principes de l'intégration continue et expérience avec les outils employés dans ce contexte (Maven, Sonar, GIT et Jenkins). Sensibilité à l'architecture et connaissance des concepts d'une architecture de type SOA/Microservices. Sensibilité aux aspects de sécurité des applications web et intérêt pour les nouvelles technologies. Nous offrons : Chez Sopra Steria, nous sommes attentifs à offrir un collectif stimulant, un espace de liberté et d'échanges, qui favorisent le développement des compétences et l'entrepreneuriat au sein d'une communauté animée par l'envie de réussir ensemble. Nous encourageons l'audace, la curiosité et la prise de responsabilités pour explorer de nouvelles voies et exploiter les technologies innovantes qui permettront de mener des transformations au bénéfice de tous. Nous offrons l'opportunité à chacun de progresser et de développer ses compétences à travers des expériences variées auprès des plus grandes entreprises européennes.

You want to combine passion and IT expertise? You are talented , motivated and ambitious ? Then, we will be more than happy to meet you ! In order to reinforce one of our teams, Arηs Developments is looking for an ETL developer(m/f) As a developer, you will be responsible for: Analysis, gathering and clarification of requirements Impact analysis on Data Warehouses Preparation of technical requirements Preparation of development environment Update/build of physical Data Model Update/Implementation of ETL jobs and SQL scripts Update/Implementation of SAP Business Objects Universes Non regression testing Gathering of user test feedback Packaging of the solution implemented Documenting required projects standards and guidelines Qualifications IBM Datastage development (specifically IBM Infosphere Datastage 11.x Enterprise parallel developments): SAP BusinessObjects 4.xx: SAP Sybase Power designer: Database design and SQL (Sybase IQ and Sybase ASE): Analysis, testing and producing written design specification and documentation: Good functional knowledge of Banking Lending area Excellent knowledge of English/French and, at least, good oral and written knowledge of French/English Aligning client’s requirements Analysing existing developments and performing impact analysis Implementing a consistent solution in line with Data Warehouse best practices and new features available with IBM Infosphere Datastage 11.3.x Performing tests, gathering feedback, and recommending changes Gathering requirements and delivering results within strict schedule Additional Information ARȠS? Arηs is a fully independent group of companies specialized in managing complex IT projects and systems for large organisations , focusing on state-of-the-art software development, business intelligence and infrastructure services. We are composed of 14 entities across 6 countries that are unified by the Arηs Group, with more than 2200 consultants . This corporate structure enables us to respond quickly to market changes and customer requests, and to communicate and make decisions without layers of bureaucracy. Our success can be attributed to the synergy among our nine complementary entities, combined with our methodologies, which are based on the Rational Unified Process (RUP) and the Scrum agile software development framework. Our Vision and Values Our vision is to be the most caring and reliable IT company on the market place for both clients and our people. Our values are: caring, agility, excellence, innovation, continual improvement, and reliability . Our values support our vision by leveraging excellence, striving for results, ensuring commitment and promoting adaptability. Our Culture We work in close partnership with our customers, turning their needs into benefits; We promote a dynamic local environment where both young and experience people can realize themselves; We leverage a flexible, independent and responsive organization. Our Brand The ArȠs (pronounce [aris]) name comes from Greek Mythology. ArȠs is the son of Zeus and the God of War – in our eyes, an accurate representation of the intelligence, strategy, leadership and vision that are essential in business. Don’t hesitate! Join our team What you’ll get: An informal hierarchy and work environment: Our open, flat structure supports a strong focus on communication and collaboration, enabling to respond quickly to market changes and customer requests. An attractive salary package: With an attractive salary and benefits package – including advantageous fringe benefits – you’ll be paid for what you love to do. A strong corporate culture: You’ll join a dynamic team of smart and ambitious people. From the way we hire, to the way we relate to our clients – our values from the foundation of the way we work. Learning & development opportunities: We constantly invest in our people and are committed to providing individual development opportunities to help you continue to grow and stay happy and satisfied at work. Exciting projects: You’ll take ownership of various projects for both public and private clients: calling for creativity and innovation, at the cutting-edge of technology. A rock solid company: With more than 200 customers , and 30% turnover growth in FY2021, you’ll join a business with a sustainable and growth-oriented plan. But let’s talk about it face to face! You have the qualities as listed above? Please, send us your CV, which will be processed in full confidentiality, by clicking the button "I'm interested" You don’t have all the above requirements but own a great part of them? Description Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment? Do you like working on industry-defining projects that move the needle? At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our interns write real software and collaborate with a selected group of experienced software development engineers who help interns on projects that matter to our customers. We want to you to feel welcomed, included and valued right from the start. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth. How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow. We Have Two Different Internship Durations Available  3 months internship  6 months internship Please ensure to indicate your availability during the application process. Key job responsibilities  Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary  Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.  Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.  Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.  Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.  Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software. A day in the life As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimisation, scalability, and security – just to name a few. In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting. Many of our technologies overlap, and you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), touching the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalise for customers. We make the impossible, possible. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Luxembourg, LUX Basic Qualifications  Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application  Although no specific programming language is required – you should be familiar with the syntax of languages such as Java, C/C++, or Python  Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving and complexity analysis. Preferred Qualifications  Previous technical internship(s) if applicable  Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases  Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimisation  Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions  Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly EMEA Student Programs Team Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
