Spire Global is a space-to-cloud analytics company that owns and operates the largest multi-purpose constellation of satellites. Its proprietary data and algorithms provide the most advanced maritime, aviation, and weather tracking in the world. In addition to its constellation, Spire’s data infrastructure includes a global ground station network and 24/7 operations that provide real-time global coverage of every point on Earth. We are looking for an innovative UI developer or software engineer to join our marketing team. You will serve the marketing and growth goals across our business units. This role will focus on building and optimizing fantastic product websites people enjoying visiting and navigating. You will work with our unique large datasets to build media and social ready example visualizations that capture the essence of what our data represents. You’ll collaborate across business units to ensure all web content developed is impactful, relevant and educational in a way that engages our target audience and becomes a component of our conversation with customers. For web, we are particularly fond of WordPress, and for visualizations, we like D3, Kepler/deck gl, and ArcGIS but you can bring your best solutions and ideas to drive the results we need. Responsibilities Working and collaborating closely with Content and Product Marketing on all interactive MarCom programs and initiatives Developing and delivering responsive web-based content and features, initially in a WordPress environment Extending support to MarCom teams for various deliverables such as data visualization content, landing pages, product demonstrations, and interactive infographics Give and take direction from cross-functional leadership, with the intent of developing the most effective interactive experience for the target audience Ensure a high standard of code quality, keeping in mind scale and establishing a precedent for future team members Iterate processes and frameworks with the expectation of iterating again Optimize the technical structures of interactive content to apply the time savings to future projects Influence the future direction of the MarCom team with business case presentations, performance audits and post-mortem reviews  What skills should you bring? At least 3+ years experience of maintainable, well-tested code, with best practices, including PHP, CSS, HTML, HTML5, and javascript  Be knowledgeable and use best practices for developing high-quality, creative, web application UX and UI design tools such as Figma or Adobe XD Comfortable with APIs, code and integrations commonly made in a marketing setting Have the ability to collaborate with Content and Product Marketing to execute the long-term strategy for our web presence Experience implementing A/B testing and leveraging analytics to improve designs for conversion Be able to execute, and advise on SEO best practices working in conjunction with the demand generation and product marketing teams Develop effective and creative designs and implement them on our CMS Re-design websites using updated brand guidelines and create creative yet effective designs Design CTAs, landing pages, banners, web pages, collateral, infographics, eBooks, & more Have the ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment, spread globally with a daily release cycle Experience in a growth marketing environment is a plus  Spire operates a hybrid work model, and this position will require you to work a minimum of three days per week in office. Access to US export controlled software and/or technology may be required. Spire is Global and our success draws upon the diverse viewpoints, skills and experiences of our employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. Description de poste Qui sommes-nous ? Notre agence du Luxembourg accompagne ses clients locaux dans leurs projets de transformation numérique, du build à la maintenance, dans des contextes principalement applicatifs. Nous les accompagnons tant dans leur gestion de projet que dans leur développement et mise en production. Parmi nos valeurs, on retrouve le partage, notamment par le biais de nos communautés internes (technique, business analyst, delivery…) et nos afterworks (introduction à l’œnologie par notre spécialiste, soirée jeux de société, marché de Noël…). CGI c’est aussi l’intégrité et l’objectivité qui passent par la transparence, retrouvée lors de nos évènements trimestriels où nous faisons le point sur notre avancée, nos objectifs, nos valeurs et notre vision. Si vous voulez un aperçu de qui nous sommes, qui sont nos membres, c’est par ici 👉 Nos membres ont du talent Et aujourd’hui, nous sommes à la recherche de notre futur(e) Développeur JAVA Back-end (F/H) pour venir renforcer nos équipes projets, accompagnant nos clients sur un de nos principaux secteurs (Public, Finance, Institutions Européennes). Si jusqu’ici notre environnement vous intéresse, prenez quelques minutes pour lire la fiche de poste 👇🏼 Fonctions et responsabilités En tant que développeur Java (F/H), vous participerez : A la phase de maintenances corrective et évolutives des applications et l’accompagnement du client Aux tests unitaires et tests de non-régression conformément aux spécifications Aux débogages des applications tout en étant force de proposition de recommandations techniques pour l’amélioration continue des applications Au déploiement et à la mise en production Qualités requises pour réussir dans ce rôle Vous justifiez à minima de 4 ans d’expérience pertinente dans une des technologies suivantes : Back end : Java 8 ou + (Stream API, Lambdas), Spring Boot Outils : Apache Camel Environnement : Linux Base de données : Oracle, MongoDB, MySQL, NoSQL Vous: êtes curieux(se) et dynamique Vous avez le goût de l’innovation, êtes autonome et aimez le travail en équipe Vous parlez français couramment et avez un bon niveau d'anglais Sont considérés comme des atouts : Expérience en pratiques agile et devops Connaissances fonctionnelles dans les domaines suivants : Wealth, Asset Management, Private Banking, Logiciel Triple A, industrie, secteur public etc. Back end : Spring, JPA/Hibernate Outils : Maven, Node / NPM, Webpack, , Git, Jenkins, SonarQube, Docker Base de données : PostgreSQL, MariaDB, DB2 NB : Chez CGI, nous reconnaissons la richesse que la diversité nous apporte. C’est pourquoi notre processus de recrutement se base uniquement sur vos compétences. En tant qu’employeur qui prône l’égalité des chances pour tous, nous voulons donner à tous nos membres les moyens de réussir et de s’épanouir. Si vous avez besoin d’un accompagnement spécifique durant le processus de recrutement et d’intégration, veuillez nous en informer. Nous serons heureux de vous aider. Vous êtes unique et ça nous plaît ! Allier savoir et faire Alors que la technologie s’inscrit au cœur de la transformation numérique de nos clients, nous savons que les individus sont au cœur du succès en affaires. Lorsque vous rejoignez CGI, vous devenez un conseiller de confiance, collaborant avec vos collègues et clients pour proposer des idées exploitables qui produisent des résultats concrets et durables. Nous appelons nos employés "membres" parce qu’ils sont actionnaires et propriétaires de CGI. Ils ont du plaisir à travailler et à grandir ensemble pour bâtir une entreprise dont nous sommes fiers. C’est notre rêve depuis 1976. Il nous a menés là où nous sommes aujourd’hui – l’une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde. Chez CGI, nous reconnaissons la richesse que la diversité nous apporte. Nous aspirons à créer une culture à laquelle nous appartenons tous et collaborons avec nos clients pour créer des communautés plus inclusives. En tant qu’employeur qui prône l’égalité des chances pour tous, nous voulons donner à tous nos membres les moyens de réussir et de s’épanouir. Si vous avez besoin d’un accompagnement spécifique durant le processus de recrutement et d’intégration, veuillez nous en informer. Nous serons heureux de vous aider. Prêt à faire partie d’une entreprise qui est gage d’excellence? Rejoignez CGI – où vos idées et vos actions changent la donne.

CLdN  is one of Europe’s leading multimodal logistics providers, composed of three vertically integrated business activities:  CLdN RoRo  operates more than 20 modern RoRo vessels offering more than 130 sailings per week.  CLdN Cargo  owns a fleet of 4500 trailers and 45ft containers and provides door-to-door logistics services, including European full-load transport, freight forwarding and freight management.  CLdN Ports  owns and operates RoRo ports in England, the Netherlands and Belgium. The roots of the CLdN Group date back to 1928. Headquartered in Luxembourg, the Group today employs close to 3,000 people. Write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks; Ensure Data Security against internal and external attack. Project & Change Management In cooperation with our Head of Infrastructure (CTO) and external consultants, review or propose design of Hardware / Software / Network configuration; Realize proof of concept (POC) on various technologies; Test for new versions and features on UAT and Pre-Production environment; Manage projects, plan resources and forecast delivery; Operate Change Management: Schedule operations in cooperation with users / IT Team / Suppliers; Verify actions plan conformity with our requirements and safe to our operations; Program and assist third party onto their actions; Report progress and milestone. Execute/follow-up of the installation by ensuring a smooth running of all IT systems; Based on management report, elaborate system functionality and ensure that IT facilities meet user needs; Ensure that software licensing laws are respected.  Skills We are looking for people with capacity to cover a multi-technology environment with high technicity in several of the following areas: WINTEL MS Windows Server including clustering / AD MS Exchange Server MS SQL Server LINUX Redhat  CLOUD Azure Office 365 Virtualization Hyper-V VMware Citrix XENAPP, XENDESKTOP MS Remote Desktop Services (RDS) Tooling and Monitoring Microsoft System Center Suite : SCOM – SCCM - SCVMM Backup: COMMVAULT; HP StoreOnce; MSL Tape Library HP IMC Zabbix Miscellaneous Experiences Load balancing, Proxy management, Mail relay  Networking: router, Firewall, switches, WLAN HP-UX and/or Linux RedHat  HP Storage & Server infrastructure (HP 3PAR; HPSIM; HP ILO) Data protection and monitoring: VARONIS Your profile  You are entrepreneurial and are able to perform to a high level of quality and responsibility at all times; You like to work in an international environment; You are fluent in English; You are reliable, well organized, stress resistant during crisis situations; You have a significant experience between 5 and 10 years in a similar function managing multiple datacenters and/or Wan/Lan-networks; You hold a University degree in IT. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you’re ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth. How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow. 2024 Luxemburg Data Engineering Internship Do you love building tools and data pipelines? Are you excited by the opportunity to create clear effective reports and data visualizations, and collaborate with stakeholders to answer key business questions? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet? If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern. Amazon is looking for a data engineer intern to join one our many lines of business. Amazon interns have the opportunity to work alongside the industry’s brightest engineers who innovate everyday on behalf of our customers. You will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to affect the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your work will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the company. In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real world setting. Key job responsibilities  Design, implement, and automate deployment of our distributed system for collecting and processing log events from multiple sources  Design data schema and operate internal data warehouses and SQL/NoSQL database systems  Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive key business decisions  Monitor and troubleshoot operational or data issues in the data pipelines  Drive architectural plans and implementation for future data storage, reporting, and analytic solutions  Work collaboratively with Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and other internal partners to identify opportunities/problems  Provide assistance to the team with troubleshooting, researching the root cause, and thoroughly resolving defects in the event of a problem A day in the life Our Data Engineers build and maintain the infrastructure to answer questions with data, using software engineering best practices, data management fundamentals, data storage principles, and recent advances in distributed systems (e g MapReduce, MPP architectures, NoSQL database. We’re looking for Data Engineer interns to join one of our many lines of business. About The Team If you’re insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you’ve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern.  Competitive pay  Impactful project and internship/role deliverables  Hybrid working (team dependent)  Networking opportunities with fellow interns  Internships events such as speaker series, intern panels, Leadership Principles sessions, Amazon writing skills sessions.  Mentorship and career development If you’re successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies Internship start dates vary throughout the year. Internship ideal length is 6 months. We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and leveraging our unique perspectives to scale our impact and grow. Amazon has 13 affinity groups (https://www.aboutamazon.com/affinity-groups), sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. With executive and company sponsorship, these groups play an important role in building internal networks for creating a community, advising Amazon business units, leading in service projects, and reaching out to communities where Amazonians live and work. Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our EMEA Student Programs Team Events page to register for one of our upcoming events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Luxembourg, LUX Basic Qualifications  Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in computer engineering, computer science, or a similar technical field  Availability to complete an internship minimum 6 months long working full time week  Experience with one or more query language (e.g., SQL, PL/SQL, DDL, MDX, HiveQL, SparkSQL, Scala)  Experience with one or more scripting language (e.g., Python, KornShell)  Experience with data mining, data warehouse solutions  Experience with ETL flow and tools Preferred Qualifications  Master’s or advance technical degree  Proficient in at least one or more query language, schema definition language, and scripting language  Knowledge of writing and optimizing SQL queries in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets  Experience with data visualization software (e.g., AWS QuickSight or Tableau) or open-source project  Experience with big data processing technology (e.g., Hadoop or ApacheSpark), data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL, and reporting/analytic tools and environments  Ability to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment We prioritize candidates who demonstrate relevant skills for this role. You may wish to attend one of our upskilling events at amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com . EMEA Student Programs Team Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. Goodyear. More Driven. STAFF DATA SCIENTIST - DES Are you interested in an exciting opportunity to help drive data driven business strategies for a large, global manufacturing company? The Data Science & Analytics team at Goodyear is seeking a technical expert in the areas of programmatic modeling and operations research to help develop and deploy new modeling solutions to support our complex business and manufacturing systems (supply chain, product distribution systems, manufacturing systems). This associate will collaborate with other members of the Data Science team as well as experts from the operations and business units to model our complex systems and provide insights that impact key strategic applications such as scheduling our manufacturing and logistics systems. The Data Science team is looking for an individual with experience in developing and implementing programmatic models to simulate complex networks as well as exposure to multiple aspects of operations and supply chain. Job Description We think you’ll be excited about having opportunities to: Develop an understanding of the tire industry and how modeling complex business systems can help Goodyear make more data driven business decisions. Collaborate with senior Data Science & Analytics team members to implement forward looking technology strategies in the area of modeling and optimization of complex business systems. Drive technology advancement in modeling, optimization and scheduling of complex systems to address the corporate business needs. Evaluate new technologies as they come into the market. Work closely with other data scientists and data engineers to scale-up digital solutions across diverse applications. Have an impact by helping us drive “best data practices” and share insights across the company. What We Need PhD in Data Science (or related field) or Master's Degree in Data Science (or related field) with 3+ years of experience in developing and deploying programmatic and/or discrete event models. Demonstrated experience in solving challenging technical problems with experience in discrete event simulation, optimization and operations research. Demonstrated knowledge in several subjects, in each of the following areas:  Programming Languages & Scripting (Python, C++) Data Engineering (handling data, working with multiple databases, leveraging data pipelines) Operation Research Applications (supply chain, manufacturing, scheduling, optimization) Social And Communication Strong communication skills: capable of conveying information concisely to diverse audiences; experience with communicating the dynamics of complex systems in a concise and clear manner. Good teamwork skills: ability to network across a global organization; ability to convince and lead; active listening skills; ability to prioritize and follow through; ability to communicate and agree on expectations; ability to work in a team environment and deliver results on time.  Goodyear is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law. Goodyear is one of the world’s largest tire companies. It employs about 74,000 people and manufactures its products in 57 facilities in 23 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. For more information about Goodyear and its products, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate

Description Amazon is seeking a motivated candidate to develop innovative solutions for our European Transportation network, with strong focus on process optimization and automation. The ideal candidate relishes partnering with all Amazon Transportation teams to identify strategic opportunities, enjoys the challenge of highly complex technical contexts, and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics. He/she is a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail) and enjoys working in a fast-paced team that continuously learns and evolves on a day to day basis. The successful candidate is comfortable facilitating ideas and working from concept through to execution, and manage a wide portfolio of projects and initiatives. By joining our team, NetWatch, you will work across all regions and teams involved in transportation execution, and have a direct impact on our customers and Amazon business. Key job responsibilities As part of the NetWatch team, you will have to: Own the automation efforts for one of our central configuration teams. Support on long-term projects key to the team. Work backward from customer needs and build automated solutions for transportation processes, reducing defects and increasing efficiency. Understand complex problems and build data-oriented frameworks and data models to make optimal decisions, ensuring alignment with all stakeholders. Build user-friendly and actionable reporting to guide decisions and enable self-service usage for users to make faster decisions. Identify defects and cost-optimization opportunities on our transportation network and build scalable processes and solutions to address them. About The Team NetWatch focuses on improving customer experience while optimizing costs and human resources by creating, optimizing and automating processes for Amazon transportation management. Additionally, we report on performance of processes and create mechanisms, framework and governance to direct senior leaders’ decision making. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Luxembourg, LUX Basic Qualifications  Experience in the data/BI space  Experience with SQL  Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools  Experience with one or more industry analytics visualization tools (e.g. Excel, Tableau, QuickSight, MicroStrategy, PowerBI) and statistical methods (e.g. t-test, Chi-squared)  Experience with scripting language (e.g., Python, Java, or R)  Experience in analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. Preferred Qualifications  Master's degree, or Advanced technical degree  Knowledge of data modeling and data pipeline design  Experience with statistical analysis, co-relation analysis Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. Requisition ID: 60429 About Whirlpool Corporation Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE: WHR) is committed to being the best global kitchen and laundry company, in constant pursuit of improving life at home. In an increasingly digital world, the company is driving purposeful innovation to meet the evolving needs of consumers through its iconic brand portfolio, including Whirlpool, KitchenAid, Maytag, Consul, Brastemp, Amana, Bauknecht, JennAir, Indesit, Yummly and InSinkErator. In 2022, the company reported approximately $20 billion in annual sales, 61,000 employees and 56 manufacturing and technology research centers. Additional information about the company can be found at WhirlpoolCorp.com. The team you will be a part of The Treasury team performs treasury operations involving cash funds, foreign exchange, debt and capital management. Ensures that financial transactions, policies, and procedures meet organization objectives, needs, and regulatory body requirements. This Role In Summary Whirlpool is seeking a Senior Treasury Analyst to join the Luxembourg Treasury Center. This position requires that the individual be able to multitask, communicate effectively, demonstrate initiative, and work well in a team environment. This role will report to the Senior Treasury Manager and will be based in Luxembourg. Your Responsibilities Will Include Forecasting and modeling of Cash, Debt, Interest Expense, and Free Cash Flow (FCF) Short-term cash forecasting (12- week forecast) and liquidity management  Manage intercompany loan portfolio and coordinate cash moves, including dividends, capital injection, major payments, and other Tax related transactions Coordinate Month-End and Quarter-End Close Processes across the Treasury Operations Team FX and commodity exposure forecasting Prepare analyses and work with banks/manager on working capital management projects, including managing Factoring&Supply Chain Finance programs Perform daily cash management activities, including pooling, in-house banking, daily cash positioning, wire transfers, tax payments, foreign exchange transactions Perform global netting  Perform Bank Administration tasks, including updating users and access rights, creation and maintenance of payment templates, and maintaining controls within each banking platform Insurance data collection for various lines of insurance Support transition of Swiss Treasury Center to new Luxembourg Treasury Center Assist with the new Treasury Management System to automate and improve current processes  Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting Minimum 2 or more years of experience in Treasury, Finance or Accounting Proficiency in English; German or French are considered a plus Preferred Skills And Experiences Treasury management systems (e.g. Quantum) Cash management Hedge trading and accounting  Financial modeling  What We Offer Competitive compensation A full-time job contract Hybrid way of working (1-2 day work from home)  Connect with us and learn more about Whirlpool Corporation See what it's like to work at Whirlpool by visitingWhirlpool Careers. Additional information about the company can be found onFacebook,Twitter,LinkedIn,InstagramandYouTube. At Whirlpool Corporation, we value and celebrate diversity. Whirlpool Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any discrimination on the basis of race or ethnicity, religion, sex, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable law.

job_title: Analyste Développeur Data Junior: ETL / C# (m/f)
job_description:
Votre job en bref Une culture d'entreprise solide qui fait des collaborateurs sa priorité. Joignez-vous à nous. C'est bien ? Allons-y Postuler maintenant Contact Ce qui vous attend Vous voulez contribuer à la valorisation du patrimoine de données d’une grande assurance luxembourgeoise afin de mieux servir le business. Le service Data du Département IT recherche un nouveau membre pour compléter son équipe de 12 personnes afin de contribuer à nos nouveaux projets métiers. Vous participerez tout aussi bien à la maintenance applicative de l’existant qu’à de grands projets ambitieux tels que la refonte de l’architecture Data, l’intégration d’un nouveau système comptable ou la mise à disposition de nouvelles fonctionnalités de reporting. Vos Tâches Regrouperont  Mise en place d'outil de gestions de metadata et des master data  Participation aux développements de différentes interfaces ETL  Contribution à la standardisation de la plateforme Data  Mise à disposition de rapports ou dashboards répondant aux besoins business et technique  Evolution de la plateforme existante Vous rapporterez directement au responsable au Responsable de l’équipe Data. Ce que nous attendons  Volonté de comprendre et de s’adapter  Motivé et passionné  Bon esprit d’équipe  Bonne communication, contact aisé  La maîtrise de la langue française et anglaise à l’oral et à l’écrit  Vous justifiez d’une expérience d’au moins 1 an sur certains des outils suivants :  SQL et T/SQL   connaissance de l’ETL SSIS  La connaissance du langage C# et de SSRS serait un atout  Des connaissance en modélisation de base de données seraient appréciées  À propos de Baloise  Nous sommes plus qu’une compagnie d’assurance traditionnelle : nous sommes le partenaire personnel de quiconque veut se sentir tout simplement en sécurité. Outre nos activités financières traditionnelles, nous nous positionnons plus largement avec des écosystèmes dans les domaines de la mobilité et de l’habitat. Nous considérons l’ère numérique comme une opportunité et aspirons à ce que notre offre de demain soit encore plus durable, plus innovante et plus orientée client. Vous voulez y participer ? Nous vous donnons la liberté de poursuivre vos idées... Investissez-vous ! Remettez-nous en question ! Continuez à évoluer et à nous faire évoluer ! Tout ceci est possible grâce à notre culture de l’apprentissage et de l’erreur ainsi qu’à une communication d’égal à égal. Parce que ce n’est qu’ensemble que nous pourrons aller de l’avant. Baloise en Luxembourg Baloise en tant qu’employeur Notre engagement durable Nos avantages Notre Culture Et Notre Solidarité Nous Rendent Uniques Mais Nos Avantages Vous Intéressent Aussi. Découvrez Ce Dont Vous Bénéficierez En Rejoignant Baloise En Luxembourg  Bien-être  Votre santé nous tient à cœur. C’est pourquoi, grâce à notre programme de santé, de bien-être et de durabilité, vous pourrvez bénéficier de conseils ergonomiques réguliers, profiter de massages, préparer des repas sains, vous essayer aux arts décoratifs, tenter la méditation, etc., sans oublier le large éventail d’activités proposées par notre club de sport, notre club de lecture, notre big band Baloise ou encore notre Baloise Golf Association.  Les avantages du monde financier  Des remises pour nos collaborateurs·trices sur nos propres produits, cela signifie: jusqu’à 40 % de rabais sur nos produits d’assurance. Vous bénéficierez également d’un plan de pension complémentaire dès votre entrée en service. Sans oublier le 13emois et les tickets repas!  Modèles de travail flexibles  Nous Vous Offrons La possibilité de travailler à distance jusqu’à deux jours par semaine (dans le respect de la loi pour les collaborateurs·trices transfrontaliers·ères) Un horaire flexible (entre 6 h 00 et 22 h 00) Du flex office 35,5 jours de congé par an  Santé  Nous sommes à vos côtés, même si vous tombez malade ou avez un accident. Au sein de Bâloise Luxembourg, vous bénéficierez d’une assurance contre les accidents professionnels et non professionnels. En outre, tous·tes les collaborateurs·trices peuvent également bénéficier d’une assurance maladie pour eux·elles-mêmes et leur famille.  Événements  Notre culture se nourrit de la convivialité, même en dehors de la routine quotidienne du bureau. Qu’il s’agisse de créer des liens lors de la fête du personnel et des after-works ou de rencontrer les enfants de nos collègues lors des journées familiales, chaque événement est une excellente occasion de partager des moments de manière moins formelle.  Culture de l'apprentissage et de l'erreur  Vous Nous Rencontrez Dans Une Période De Changement. Et Bien Sûr, Là Où Il y a De La Nouveauté, Il y a Aussi Des Choses Qui Ne Fonctionnent Pas Toujours. C’est Normalet C’est Ainsi Que Nous Apprenons, Que Nous Évoluons, Que Nous Empruntons De Nouvelles Voies Et Que Nous Nous Efforçons D’avoir Une Culture Saine De L’erreur. Nos Nombreuses Initiatives Montrent à Quel Point L’apprentissage Continu Est Important Pour Nous Du temps pour apprendre pendant votre temps de travail  Un programme de développement et de formation mis à jour trois fois par an afin de proposer de nouvelles offres adaptées à vos besoins Des journées d’essai au sein d’autres équipes («Shadow for a Day») Des possibilités dechangement temporaire de poste en interne («changement de perspective») Un accès gratuit à LinkedIn Learning  Rejoignez-nous : Analyste Développeur Data Junior: ETL / C# (m/f)   Postuler maintenant

Job Location: Luxembourg Luxembourg Company Description Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? 38,767 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them. Diversity Statement Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding. About the Role: For our Ferrero HQs in Luxembourg, we are currently looking for Accounts Payable specialist within the Finance team, who will be reporting to the Accounts Payable and Receivable Responsible. Main Responsibilities: Join our team in a pivotal role supporting  Accounts Payable and Receivable operations . Working closely with our Business Process Outsourcer, your primary responsibility is to ensure the precise  execution of accounting procedures  within established deadlines and protocols. This includes  monitoring monthly reconciliations  and  end-to-end processes  to ensure flawless execution. Your role involves closely  tracking and analyzing KPIs  related to  Accounts Payable and Receivable . You'll  monitor  elements like  invoices pending receipt, credit note processing, invoice error rates, advanced payment management, and unapplied cash monitoring . You're also central to transitory account reconciliations and providing essential  support during month-end closing  procedures. Investigating invoice discrepancies  is another vital aspect of your role. You'll identify root causes,  implement corrective actions  promptly, and ensure effective follow-up.  Timely responses  to inquiries regarding payment details and invoice statuses, both internally and externally, are part of your routine. Communication is key , and you'll maintain clear and updated dialogues with our Procurement Functions to ensure their understanding of accounting policies and procedures.  Collaborating with various teams , including IT, Procurement, Internal Audit, and Legal, you'll analyze current business processes,  seeking opportunities for improvement  and streamlining. Finally, you'll play an instrumental role in  supporting the year-end audit process , ensuring the collection of relevant documentation and seamless collaboration with external auditors for a precise and timely year-end closing and reporting. Who we are looking for: You will bring your Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business and  3 to 5 years of accounting experience . You value  proactive, analytical mindset and excellent communication , teamwork,  problem-solving , and organizational skills. You have a solid understanding of generally accepted  accounting principles . In this role, you'll interact with various teams, including Leadership, Operations, Business Process Outsourcing, Governance Risk & Compliance, Group Financial Standards, IT, and Procurement. You have experience in SAP, MS-Office applications (especially Excel), and possibly Power BI. You are h ighly results driven and self-motivated , you'll be a valuable team player who contributes to our ongoing success and your own career growth. Join our team, where your  proactive approach and analytical skills  will be key as you navigate your journey towards success. How to be successful in the role and at Ferrero: Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

La Banque de Luxembourg compte parmi les plus importantes banques privées de la Place. Depuis plus de 100 ans, elle accompagne des particuliers, des familles et des entrepreneurs dans la préservation, la valorisation et la transmission de leur patrimoine. Elle propose également ses services à des clients professionnels des métiers de la gestion d'actifs, dans l'esprit d'un banquier privé. Au sein de l'équipe «  Credit Analysis  » vous serez en charge d'analyser les différentes demandes de crédits d'un point de vue risque de crédit et d'émettre un avis indépendant. En tant que  Credit Analyst , expérimenté·e, vous prenez en charge les missions suivantes : Vous réalisez des analyses complètes de demandes de crédit (immobiliers, lombards, facilités de caisse, d'investissement, de consommation, personnels) tant pour des entreprises (industrielles, commerciales ou patrimoniales) que pour une clientèle de gestion privée ou encore une clientèle fonds d'investissement. Vous identifiez les risques financiers, juridiques et fiscaux inhérents aux crédits, vous émettez des avis indépendants et présenter les dossiers de crédit à soumettre aux organes décisionnels. Vous participez aux processus de suivi des crédits, de renouvellement et de modification des crédits existants. Vous participez aux différents groupes de travail transversaux afin d'amélioration les processus et de rechercher une meilleure efficience. Fort·e d'une expérience de 5 ans minimum dans une fonction similaire dans le domaine des crédits au sein d'un établissement bancaire, vous souhaitez rejoindre une Banque qui vous accompagnera tout au long de votre carrière. Vous êtes diplômé·e d'un Master en économie, finance ou comptabilité. Vous possédez une expérience avérée dans les crédits et garanties bancaires pour une clientèle professionnelle (entreprises industrielles, commerciales ou patrimoniales) et privée ; Vous avez de bonnes connaissances juridiques et fiscales en lien avec la matière des crédits ; Vous vous distinguez par vos capacités d'analyse et de synthèse ; Vous êtes rigoureux·se et êtes reconnu pour vos compétences rédactionnelles ; Organisé·e, vous avez une bonne maitrise de votre stress et savez gérer les priorités tout en communicant de manière pédagogique avec vos différents interlocuteurs·trices ; Vous maitrisez le français et l'anglais, l'allemand constitue un atout. Convaincu·es que notre diversité fait notre force, nous sommes signataires de la Charte de la Diversité, Lëtzebuerg. Attentif·ves à l'égalité des chances, nous nous engageons à travers des actions concrètes, notamment en faveur des jeunes talents, des femmes, des collaborateurs seniors… Vous souhaitez … Rejoindre des équipes composées de femmes et d'hommes d'horizons multiples, aux parcours et compétences complémentaires Vous développer dans un cadre de travail respectant l'équilibre vie privée-vie professionnelle Évoluer dans un environnement propice à l'épanouissement de tous les talents… Adressez-nous votre CV accompagné d'une lettre de motivation via notre Espace Candidats. Pour information, un extrait du casier judiciaire de moins de 2 mois vous sera demandé avant la conclusion de tout contrat de travail.

job_title: Business Intelligence Engineer (L4), EU CF Process Engineering
job_description:
Description Are you interested in a high-impact role with exposure to senior leaders? The EU Process Engineering Team is seeking a customer-focused Business Intelligence Engineer with strong analytical and technical skills to drive performance measurement, innovation, and execution in Fulfillment Centre Operations. Collaborating closely with Amazon Fulfillment Center Operations and data teams, you will be responsible for developing analytics dashboards, deep-dive tools, and influencing product roadmaps using data, AWS services, and insights. As a Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE I), your responsibilities include:  Managing intake, coordinating, and gathering requirements from business partners to handle increased data volume and the demand for more cost-efficient and scalable pipelines and tech solutions.  Prioritizing initiatives, Designing and implementing technical solutions with appropriate strategies and design principles.  Driving best practices in Operational Excellence. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in SQL, Redshift, metrics development, and dashboard creation using tools like QuickSight. Experience in programming is a must. You should excel in translating customer and business opportunities into innovative business intelligence solutions and demonstrate a passion for working with extensive datasets to drive data-driven decisions and build models that address critical questions for our stakeholders. We are open to hiring candidates to work out any location within European Fulfillment Centers or Corporate Office. About The Team The EU PE is a group of Process Engineers located all over Europe. We are proudly part of the Ops team. Our aim is to eliminate processes variation across FCs, guiding, promoting and scaling at network level cutting edge best practices. We foster a culture of Day 1, stimulating ideas with a positive Continuous Improvement and Problem-Solving Mindset. We believe that every defect is an opportunity and we work to create higher standard every day. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Luxembourg, LUX Basic Qualifications  Experience gathering business requirements, using industry standard business intelligence tool(s) to extract data, formulate metrics and build reports  Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools  Experience with one or more industry analytics visualization tools (e.g. Excel, Tableau, QuickSight, MicroStrategy, PowerBI) and statistical methods (e.g. t-test, Chi-squared)  Experience with scripting language (e.g., Python, Java, or R)  Experience with SQL  Experience in the data/BI space Preferred Qualifications  Experience with statistical analysis, co-relation analysis  Experience in Data Project Management: Proven experience in successfully managing complex data projects, ensuring timely delivery and stakeholder satisfaction. Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. 🤔 C'est quoi SFEIR ?  SFEIR, c'est avant tout une communauté de 900 techs en France, en Belgique et au Luxembourg.  Nous aidons nos clients à : 🔹 Être compatible avec le futur en développant leurs architectures SI, Cloud et Data ; 🔹 Donner de la valeur à leurs données, innover avec l'IA ; 🔹 Créer de la valeur grâce aux API & microservices; 🔹 Développer des applications web et mobiles pour améliorer leur expérience client et se connecter partout. Notre culture d'entreprise est résolument tournée vers l'expertise technologique, la transmission de connaissances et le respect de nos valeurs phares : bienveillance, inclusivité, excellence, liberté, responsabilité.  Et Luxembourg dans tout ça ?  SFEIR Luxembourg c'est :  🔹 Une centaine de développeur.euse.s qui se connaissent toutes et tous ; 🔹 2 Directeurs Engineering qui sont aussi des consultants @GuillaumeHomberg, @RenaudChardin ; 🔹 Une vingtaine de clients actifs en local et une centaine au niveau du groupe ; 🔹 Des événements en interne et externes organisés chaque mois (afterworks, webinars, meetup, formations) ; 🔹 Une communauté active : une cinquantaine de conférences externes données en 2022 (Voxxed Days, DevFest, Devoxx, communauté JS, …) ; 🔹 Des locaux situés à 2 pas de la gare centrale ; 💪 Ce qui fait notre force ? 🔹  Achieve greatness  - Notre culture est digital native.  L’agilité est au cœur de notre fonctionnement. On s’est inspirés des pratiques des entreprises Digital Natives pour construire notre succès : agilité, rapidité dans les prises de décision, organisation décentralisée, promotion et utilisation de l’Open Source, etc. 🔹  Proud to be developers  - Notre stratégie est co-construite, par les Techs pour les Techs. La direction générale et la direction de chaque agence sont co-leadées par 2 Managing Directors : Business & Engineering Individuellement, chaque développeur et développeuse reporte à un Engineering Manager. Ce dernier est lui-même développeur et a du temps dédié pour manager. Il travaille étroitement avec le Business pour proposer les missions les plus adaptées à chacun. 🔹  Learn & Share  - Notre communauté est apprenante et dans le partage. Nous sommes partenaires officiels de Google Cloud, AWS, Microsoft, Confluent, MongoDB, Linux Foundation, GitLab, SaFe, Snowflake, Looker, entre autres. On a nos propres dispositifs de formation (SFEIR Institute, SFEIR Schools, …). Ça nous permet de former officiellement nos clients et nos devs. Nous sommes présents à de nombreux évènements Techs au niveau national et régional : tu as sûrement croisé des Sfeiriennes et Sfeiriens si tu vas aux Meetups, aux DevFest ou aux Hackathons (Health et Industry Camp). 👩‍💻 👨‍💻 Qui sont les Sfeiriennes et les Sfeiriens ?  100% des développeur.euse.s sont des techs passionné.e.s par leur métier. Ce qui nous rassemble aussi, c’est notre envie de contribuer à la communauté et à l’entreprise. On a une hiérarchie très plate : on croit que l’entreprise est plus performante quand elle favorise l’autonomie et l’intelligence collective. Tu t’attendais à ce qu’on te parle d’études, de diplômes ou d’expérience, dans cette section ? Chez SFEIR, on n’a qu’un seul critère : c’est ton niveau technique et ta culture tech. On en reparle un peu plus bas ! 🤷‍♂️🤷‍♀️ Concrètement, quel sera mon job ?  On travaille avec une trentaine de clients. Ce sont des grandes entreprises du monde de la banque, assurance, industrie ou des startups/scaleups. En mission pour l’un d’entre eux ou sur notre Factory, sur des stacks récentes, tu conçois et développes des solutions logicielles en Java. Chez nous, pas de TMA en Java 8… Mais plutôt sur des projets de transformation ou de build de nouveaux produits 😉 Au-delà de ta maîtrise de Java et de son écosystème (ex : Spring, Quarkus …) tu es quelqu'un de curieux(se) et dans le partage ! @AudreyBazile, @ClémentHuaux, @SamarKhiari & @SihamRefaa, nos super Account Managers, seront à ton écoute pour définir avec toi le projet idéal et tu pourras en changer lorsque tu en auras fait le tour. 🚀 Et si je souhaite évoluer ?  On se doute que tu veux te développer. Et on a réfléchi à ce qui pourrait te plaire. Une fois que tu as fait le tour de ton poste, voilà différents rôles que tu pourrais prendre chez SFEIR (mais ce n'est pas une obligation) :  🔹 Si tu veux rester 100% Tech : les  Staff Engineer  sont des référents techniques dans leur domaine et consacrent entre 1 et 4 jours par semaine à la communauté, en diffusant du savoir technique : formations, conseil aux managers, réponse aux appels d’offres avec l’équipe commerciale, …   🔹 Si tu veux t’orienter vers du Management : Les  Engineering Managers  sont les référents des Développeurs en mission. Tu serais leur coach pour les aider à se sentir bien dans leur job, les faire grandir et suivre leur carrière.   Tu auras également la possibilité de prendre des casquettes supplémentaires en interne si tu le souhaites :  🔹 Tech Recruiter dans le processus de recrutement ; 🔹 Trainer aux SFEIR Schools ou au SFEIR Institute ; 🔹 Speaker lors de conférences, meetups, talks, auprès des écoles, … Et si tu as d'autres envies, on en discute. Chacun est différent et on fait au cas par cas. 💰 Combien tu vas gagner chez SFEIR ? Chez nous, pas de grille de salaire figée dans le marbre ! Cependant, il est important pour nous de garder une homogénéité entre les salarié(e)s en se basant sur les compétences et le marché actuel.  On pourra t’en dire plus dès que tu auras passé notre process de recrutement technique, les PlayOffs, car les salaires que nous proposons ne prennent pas en compte ton âge, tes diplômes ou ton background. Tes compétences, rien que tes compétences ! En revanche, on peut te dire que, peu importe le salaire, un “Comité Carrière” annuel suit ton évolution et te permet de revoir ta rémunération chaque année.  Tu bénéficieras également des avantages suivants :  🔹 Matériel mis à disposition : MacBook Pro ou Dell ; 🔹 Véhicule de fonction & carte carburant (pas obligatoire) ; 🔹 Assurance santé complémentaire ; 🔹 Carte restaurant Sodexo ; 🔹 Prime d’intéressement ; 🔹 Crédit formation de 2500 euros (tous les deux ans) pour te permettre de te former/certifier et d’assister aux meilleures conférences dans le monde !  💻 Présentiel ou télétravail ? Les deux, mon capitaine ! On s’adapte à nos clients, mais la plupart sont en hybride. On se doit simplement de respecter la limite légale pour les frontaliers. 👋 “Je suis intéressé(e), comment vous rejoindre ?” Si cette annonce a attiré ton attention, il ne te reste plus qu'à postuler !  @JonathanWolter, @PhilippeJourdan, @JulienPawlowski ou @JustineLelong se feront un plaisir de t'en dire plus. Tu pourras ensuite te frotter à nos célèbres PlayOffs : 3 tests d'évaluation technique en pair-programming (algorithmie, langage, framework).  Tu trouves ça effrayant ? Pas de panique, nos évaluateur.trice.s sont bienveillants.e.s 😉 Ils te donneront aussi un aperçu de la culture d’entreprise et de la vie chez nous ! Tu pourras aussi discuter avec un commercial qui te présentera nos clients et projets, si tu le souhaites. Max 2 jours après les PlayOffs, on revient vers toi pour te débriefer, et : 🔹 Soit, on te dit sur quels aspects tu peux encore progresser et on te donne des billes pour que tu puisses retenter ta chance après un peu de pratique ; 🔹 Soit, on te fait une proposition d’embauche. Si tu as encore des questions, contacte-nous sur LinkedIn ! Et sinon, clique sur  Postuler  ✌️

job_title: 2024 Graduate Software Dev Engineer - Machine Learning
job_description:
Job ID: 2519605 | Amazon Services Europe SARL (LU) - A61 Apply now View transcript Description Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment? Do you like working on industry-defining projects that move the needle? At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our Software Development Engineers (SDEs) use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand. If this is you, come chart your own path at Amazon! The challenges SDEs solve for at Amazon are big and impact millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. We’re looking for individuals who are excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years. Key job responsibilities  Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.  Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.  Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.  Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.  Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Luxembourg, LUX Basic Qualifications  Graduated less than twelve months ago or about to complete a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application  Experience with Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, or Deep Learning  Experience with Natural Language Processing: Java or Python, and ML, AI, Labeling, Annotation, Data Pipeline, Big Data, AWS, or Cloud Services  Experience with Computer Vision: Kernel, Hardware Accelerator, TVM, or Code-gen  Experience with Deep Learning: C++ or Python, and AI, Neural Network, Tensorflow, PyTorch, MxNET, Llvm, Compiler, CPU, CUDA, Nvidia, TensorRT, TPU, Cluster Management, High Performance Computing, or Optimization Preferred Qualifications  Previous technical internship(s) if applicable  Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases  Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimisation  Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions  Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly EMEA Student Programs Team Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. ROLE DESCRIPTION SUMMARY The Ground Operations Engineer is responsible for providing expert technical support for satellite ground systems and for leading and/or interacting with cross departmental teams to support the design, implementation and smooth handover of satellite ground systems for the next generation satellite networks in MEO and GEO (e.g. HTS, SES-17 and mPOWER) which should be implemented and operated for SES considering all aspects of systems, services, procedures and any other constraints. Therefore, for this position you shall have outstanding experience as pragmatic system support engineer in the Radio Frequency & Satellite Communications domain. You will be responsible for  (this is not an exhaustive list) : Offer technical support for satellite ground systems to peers/customers in- and outside the company as an established expert in the satellite and terrestrial ground engineering field and act as a trusted representative of the team and the company (there may appear situations when support outside working hours will be needed) Perform system handover from Ground System Integration team to SES operation team including:  Deliver necessary training on ground system to SES operation/Customer  Prepare and deliver As-built system documentation  Active follow-up and closer of pending action item/ ground system deliverables Conduct house integration of ground station components and subsystems including antennas, High Power Amplifiers (HPAs), switch matrix, up/down converters, modulators, inter-facility connection equipment and Co-lo space under the guideline of engineering team Implement integration of measurement, communications and monitoring and control systems (including Service IOT and M&C Systems) under the guideline of engineering department. Perform system upgrades for existing ground systems to bring them to latest technology level that SES needs to fulfil their mission on a global basis Carry out configuration and testing of ground station equipment and software Take care of the remote configuration, management and troubleshooting of GW Infrastructure Execute periodic calibration of ground systems as per the guideline of engineering team Participate in ground system integration and test and operational validation of the ground segment, including generation of test plans and procedures and participation in system acceptance testing, ground readiness tests and network readiness tests Interface and engage with external partners (e.g. customers, etc.) Your Profile Must Have A recognized Electrical/Telecommunications Engineering degree (BS/MS or similar) with a knowledge of RF and telecom theory 1 to 4 years of “hands-on” engineering experience in satellite ground systems and worked successfully as Development or Systems Engineer and as Project Manager Experience in RF measurement techniques, test and verification of ground stations, and expertise in auxiliary systems like Network (IP, switching, routing), Monitoring and Control systems, power, HVAC and civil engineering Proven experience with tools like Word, Excel, Excel VBA, Powerpoint, MS Project, Visio, AutoCad, Lotus Notes, Windows and Linux Willingness to travel for 25% of the time Fluency in written and oral English Nice to Have Foster a culture of continuous learning by sharing your knowledge and expertise with your team members. Offer assistance and guidance when needed and act as a mentor for colleagues; Work collaboratively with others by actively participating in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and problem-solving activities. Promote a positive and inclusive work environment where team members feel comfortable sharing their ideas and working together to achieve common goals. Efficient analytical skills, coordination & priority setting facility, problem solving, project & time management, critical task decision making, as well as the ability to provide practical conclusions What's In It For You Flexible working policy Bonus and equity plans Comprehensive and competitive benefits plan A range of wellness activities and employee assistance programs  An employer that values all aspects of Diversity and respects every individual’s story GOOD TO KNOW SES is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to workplace diversity & inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or other characteristics protected by local, state, or federal law.

The Cloud Consultant is responsible for guiding clients through their cloud adoption journey, specializing in Azure and M365 environments. He will support clients in defining their cloud strategy, assessing needs, and designing tailored solutions. The Cloud Consultant will work closely with project teams, ensuring smooth execution and providing technical expertise throughout the project life cycle. He will also contribute to the continuous development of the Cloud Consulting team's expertise and conduct assessment and advisory services on identity and access management, security best practices, governance, and data management. job_title: Software Development Engineer, EUIC Core Search CX
job_description:
Description The EU INTech Consumer Selection Discovery team is looking for Software Development Engineers who are passionate about solving highly ambiguous and challenging problems at global scale. As an SDE, you will be responsible for major components of the team, you will design, develop, deliver and support a variety of software applications in collaboration with a variety of roles and partner teams around the world. You will influence technical direction, drive operational excellence best practices and maintain quality on team deliverables. You will also have the opportunity to learn from high-performing software engineering teams and mentor junior members. Key job responsibilities Our engineers work on various components of retail: Search, Detail Page, Cart, Checkout, Post-Purchase. We build end-to-end from idea, tech design to implementation and weblab experimentation. You will work directly with PMTs and UX designers on fleshing out software requirements. Remember, you do not have to tick every box to apply for the role. If you are excited about joining us and think you have what we are looking for, we would love to hear from you. About The Team The mission of the EU INTech Consumer Selection Discovery teams is to help customers find, evaluate and compare products they like, need or want. Our vision is that every customer should be confident to find the best product for their specific needs and preferences at the best value with very low effort. We believe that every customer and their situation require specific attention and so we build delightful shopping experiences that are tailored to the customer’s mission. We innovate from the EU for global customers. We don’t settle for an average 'one size fits all' and find the right CX for customers on each product family while delivering a cohesive sitewide CX. job_title: Sr Machine Learning Applied Scientist , TEN Search
job_description:
Description Amazon is looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive applied scientist with Machine Learning and optionally Search background to join the TEN Search team. As an applied scientist, you will invent, build and deploy state of the art machine-learning models and systems to enable and enhance the team's mission—real world incarnations of some of the most difficult academic problems. You will work with the largest online retail search application in the world, both in terms of users, catalogue size, and computing resources, and your work will directly impact millions of our customers. You will collaborate with recognized experts in science and engineering to develop novel algorithms and modeling techniques to advance the state-of-the-art in search and natural language processing. You will partner closely with our engineering teams, present your work to product and engineering teams at Amazon, publish scientific papers and apply for patents for your inventions. Key job responsibilities  Work on research projects in machine learning and related fields to create highly innovative customer experiences;  Analyze large amounts of data to discover patterns, find opportunities, and develop highly innovative, scalable algorithms to seize these opportunities;  Validate models via statistically rigorous experiments across millions of customers;  Work closely with software engineering teams to build scalable prototypes for testing, and integrate successful models and algorithms in production systems at very large scale;  Work side by side with fellow applied scientists in the team. About The Team TEN Search, for Transitioning Emerging & New stores , works on the relevance of search results for international stores with a focus on non-mature stores. Non-mature stores are typically stores that launched recently or are about to launch. This includes -but is not limited to - the following stores: amazon.nl, amazon.se, amazon.com.be, amazon.com.br, amazon.com.mx, amazon.eg, amazon.sg, amazon.au. Our aim is to bring quality search results to customers around the world through world class machine learning and AI innovation. Our team is based in Luxembourg, and includes scientists and machine learning engineers with education and experience from top institutions from across the globe. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Luxembourg, LUX Basic Qualifications  PhD + ML industry experience, or Master's degree and 5+ years of Computer Science, Machine Learning or related field experience  Experience in applying machine learning to real-world problems, with demonstrated impact on product or service outcomes  Experience in intellectual contributions to the field, evidenced by patents, publications in top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals, blog posts, or equivalent achievements.  Experience and programming skills in at least one major programming language such as Java, C++ or Scala  Experience and strong programming skills in Python or equivalent scripting languages with a focus on ML applications Preferred Qualifications  Experience as a lead applied scientist in large-scale, data-driven environments, guiding complex projects from research to implementation  Proven track record in addressing and solving complex, large-scale business challenges using machine learning, with demonstrable positive outcomes on business metrics.  Strong experience in building consensus and driving solutions among multi-disciplinary teams across global locations, demonstrating effective multi-cultural communication.  Knowledge of software engineering best practices, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, and how to scale, test and make systems fault tolerant.  Scientific publications track record Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. job_description:
Description Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology? Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment? Do you like working on industry-defining projects that move the needle? At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our Software Development Engineers (SDEs) use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand. If this is you, come chart your own path at Amazon! The challenges SDEs solve for at Amazon are big and impact millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. We’re looking for individuals who are excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years. Key job responsibilities  Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.  Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.  Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.  Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.  Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Luxembourg, LUX Basic Qualifications  Graduated less than twelve months ago or about to complete a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application  Experience with Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, or Deep Learning  Experience with Natural Language Processing: Java or Python, and ML, AI, Labeling, Annotation, Data Pipeline, Big Data, AWS, or Cloud Services  Experience with Computer Vision: Kernel, Hardware Accelerator, TVM, or Code-gen  Experience with Deep Learning: C++ or Python, and AI, Neural Network, Tensorflow, PyTorch, MxNET, Llvm, Compiler, CPU, CUDA, Nvidia, TensorRT, TPU, Cluster Management, High Performance Computing, or Optimization Preferred Qualifications  Previous technical internship(s) if applicable  Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases  Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimisation  Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions  Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly EMEA Student Programs Team Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. Who we are and what we do      NorthStar Earth & Space uses optical telescope data as the building blocks to create information services tailored to the needs and requirements of clients from both government and industry. Our extensive development portfolio includes orbit dynamics and machine learning algorithms for a variety of applications for space domain awareness and space traffic management. With headquarters in Montreal, Canada, European headquarters in Luxembourg and a wholly owned subsidiary in McLean, Virginia, the company is solving the ever-increasing threat of space collisions and empowering humanity to preserve our planet.      To support the growth of our Luxembourg office, we are looking for a Software Developer with 1 to 2 years of experience.    Who you'll work with         The Luxembourg software development team, Starlux, is responsible for building customer facing applications, leveraging the data generated or ingested by NorthStar’s satellites. Using mostly Java, the team is building a service-oriented architecture to fulfill the needs of the future customers.  What you will do       We are counting on you to:       Design, implement, test, and deploy the NorthStar processing pipeline and software capabilities.   Configure and deploy application workflows for automated and on-demand data processing.   Conduct and participate in technical discussions, design reviews, code reviews and feature verifications with our research and development teams.   Create and maintain software and products technical documentations (API, Services, etc.).  Participate in business and technology development discussions to support the successful planning and execution of the product roadmap.    What you bring to the table       Minimum 1 to 2 years of experience as a Software Developer.  A bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, mathematics, physics or equivalent. Some experience with programming languages such as Java or C++.  Familiarity with relational or NoSQL databases. Demonstrated willingness to learn new skills and absorb new knowledge.  Possess a self-starter attitude and the ability to work autonomously.  Openness, transparency and collegiality in your everyday work.   Strong communication and problem-solving skills and eagerness to take on new challenges.   Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and multidisciplinary environment, managing multiple tasks simultaneously.  Knowledge of French is an asset.         What you can expect       Contribute to a company whose mission is to protect our planet and Space.    You will work with a highly collaborative team of world-class experts in different domains. This will provide you with better awareness of challenges in Space and on Earth and their impact on our environment.  A stimulating challenge and a high-visibility project.     A competitive salary.      Flexible working hours.    An office located within walking distance of the historic city center and the main railway station.        NorthStar is committed to creating and fostering a safe and inclusive work environment where our employees feel valued and heard. We strongly encourage applications from candidates from different backgrounds who can bring greater diversity to the way we think, including racialized and Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities and persons of all ages, backgrounds, sexual orientations, gender identities and gender expressions.

Who we are: Brady makes products that make the world a safer and more productive place. We are a global leader in safety, identification and compliance solutions for a diverse range of workplaces. Must be flexible and quick to adapt to changes and issues. Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated experience working with Agile development environment teams #LI-Hybrid

Adobe's Applied Science and Machine Learning team is looking for a software engineer to develop evaluation systems for the latest generative models. Evaluation science is a dynamic group of engineers and researchers with expertise spanning software engineering, web development, machine learning, and human-computer interaction. You will have an opportunity to work with the latest AI-supported tools and conceptualize approaches to understand how to make them easier and safer to use for creative professionals and everyday users alike. An ideal candidate is a Python expert with 3+ years of work experience. You will work closely with machine learning engineers, researchers, and product managers to develop end-to-end systems for evaluating Adobe Firefly, Adobe's suite of generative models.  Main responsibilities :   Design core Python modules that interact with state-of-the-art generative models.   Curate large-scale datasets for model evaluation.   Create data visualization applications to support image evaluation and drive business decision-making .   Analyze and improve the efficiency and scalability of the model evaluation systems.  Minimum Requirements  Expertise in Python .   Experience with building and interfacing with REST APIs.   Experience with data visualization technologies, such as Streamlit , d3.js, vega (lite).   Experience working with CI/CD pipeline.   Experience with database systems .   Some experience with Splunk, New Relic  A successful teammate will also meet the following criteria:  Active participation in design and architecture discussions   Excellent communication and collaboration skills   Ability to work independently and take initiatives.   Familiarity with public cloud technologies such as AWS EC2, S3, and RDS  #fireflygenai Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $124,000 -- $234,200 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process. At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP). In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award. Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more. Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015. Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.
